affordancegrid.name: Affordance Grid
affordancegrid.flavor: Motion is a state of mind
affordancegrid.description: The caster manipulates the ka-grid of a mechanism to increase or decrease its affordances, making it run more or less smoothly for about an hour.

ranks.effect: A small, soap-sized mechanism, like a lock, becomes easier [+] or harder [-] to open or otherwise use for about an hour.
A stone-sized mechanism becomes easier or harder to use.
A sack-sized mechanism becomes easier or harder to use.
A wagon-sized mechanism becomes easier or harder to use.

properties.name: Frictionless
properties.description: For triple the price the mechanism becomes either frictionless (essentially free-moving) or completely jammed. This releases or blocks locks.

properties.name: Maintain
properties.description: The effect persists as long as the object is imbued.

animachine.name: Animachine
animachine.flavor: Put a ghost in its shell.
animachine.description: The ga-hackerjee pours their own ghost into a machine. A hissing electroplasmic gas of stem techware recreates a shadow of the machine’s original ghost.

ranks.effect: Revives a machine that is out of fuel, but otherwise functional.
Revives a machine with minor damage to its command and control systems.
A corroded or damaged wreck heaves into motion.
A centuries-old machine activates, though out of fuel, parts, and style.
Destroyed parts, machine fossils basically, recombine into an unscientific mockery of their original form. But, it works.

properties.name: Focus
properties.description: To command a machine.

properties.name: Imbue
properties.description: Doubles the price (minimum 1), but anyone can command the revived machine.

accordionofthepassions.name: Accordion of the Passions
accordionofthepassions.flavor: Emotions as an instrument to play.
accordionofthepassions.description: The wizard uses the ancient assisted rhetorics of voice, gesture, light, and tele-empathy to modulate sentients’ emotions.

ranks.effect: A target’s existing emotional state is enhanced. Anger turns to rage, sadness to depression. If the wizard focusses, they gain [+] to social tests against the target.
A target’s emotional state is flipped to a different emotion.
Target experiences an acute emotional crisis. Labile creatures or those in difficult circumstances may experience a psychotic break.

properties.name: Group
properties.description: Spell price x2. The modulation affects a small crowd. Maybe a dozen people.

properties.name: Mob
properties.description: Spell price x4. Affects a medium crowd. Up to 100 people.

properties.name: Throng
properties.description: Spell price x8. Affects a large crowd. 1,000 people.

anchoroftheessences.name: Anchor of the Essences
anchoroftheessences.description: The wizard binds a target’s ha, ka, and ba together so tightly they can not be unbound. The destruction of one does not release the others. Many scribes aver that this spell has been misused during enhanced interrogations.

ranks.effect: While the wizard focusses, a target does not die until all three of its essences are destroyed.
While the target is imbued with the wizard’s power, it cannot die until all three of its essences are destroyed.

Further, the target is imbued with a shadowy fourth essence, a šwt. The šwt may be bound in a precious object, such as a jewel, pearl, or quantum obelisk. The šwt does not need to stay near the target. So long as the šwt is whole, the target cannot die. Even if its ha, ka, and ba are destroyed; they can be recreated from the history they wove together with the šwt.

animateecology.name: Animate Ecology
animateecology.description: The gaintherist animates plants and fungi in a small area with their urgent essence. Flush with animal vigour, bushes roll forth, trees spring up.

ranks.effect: Flowers open, leaves sway, spores release.
Foliage, tendrils, and branches move to open passages and obscure passage.
Bushes roll in to block passage, branches batter like clubs.
Plants uproot themselves into motion, marching with the speed of a human.
Trees and bundles of smaller plants attack like ogres.
Great trees strike like giants, wicker men rise from swamps.
A whole copse lifts up and marches, a titan on the move.
Megafloral kaiju.

properties.name: Autonomy
properties.description: If the gaintherist imbues the flora, it continues to move under its own strange will.

properties.name: Expanse
properties.description: Double spell cost to affect a large area.

asbelowsoabove.name: As Below So Above
asbelowsoabove.description: The zu-yuga paints a map of reality, then judiciously alters it to change the territory of reality.

ranks.effect: Location. A mark appears where the wizard, or one whose substance they possess, is found.
Passage. A door swings open, a wall crumbles, a thicket withers.
Bridge. Stone grows, cables stretch, branches interlock.
Trap. Pits excavate, spikes thrust, flames gather.
Life. Oozes, slimes, gelatines, and offal growths spontaneously generate and populate.
Corruption. Floors grow hands, ceilings grow eyes, trees grow ripping hands.
Subversion. Gravity reverses, floodwaters ready themselves, air turns to poison.
Omission. Creatures disappear, memories are lost, treasures turn to dust.
Creation. Houses, manors, castles, trees spring up, simulated peons to till lands, illusory mentors to fill dreams.

properties.name: Ka attack
properties.description: If a soul is unwilling.

properties.name: Map
properties.description: Each stroke must be in the wizard’s own hand, but they can copy an existing map. The larger or more precise the map, the longer making it takes. The map may be of a mind or a kingdom, a ship or a story. Individual maps are small (1 soap), but a robust carrying case is not (1 stone).

beseechearthandsky.name: Beseech Earth and Sky
beseechearthandsky.description: The bokubok spends several minutes creating a makeshift shrine, aligning a few rocks and scratching celestial marks in the dirt. Then they use a small offering, perhaps a libation of wine or a few trail crackers, to attract the attention of a local daemon.

ranks.effect: The wizard may ask three questions of the daemon and receive instruction on the local area. For example, it might reveal where a spring could be found, if people have camped there, or if a large monster lives nearby. The imp is not all-knowing, but will try to answer truthfully if the wizard convinces them to help.
The wizard begs assistance. A convinced daemon grants three boons—[+] to tests or misplaced mundane objects. The wizard can use these boons in the local area over the next day and night.
A convinced daemon gives a gift. Perhaps an unusually lucky rock, stick, or flower (1 stone). This gift carries three [+] usable over the next week and a day.
A convinced daemon carries out a small task over the next week and a day. Perhaps a door will be left unlocked, a guard will fall asleep, or a termite-infested granary will finally collapse.
A convinced daemon manifests a visible sign over the next week and a day. A stream might run red, the sun grow dim, crops wither, or frogs grow wings.
A convinced daemon subverts a course of events over the next week and a day. A sick man recovers, but another dies, a pregnant woman loses her child, but a barren woman quickens.

properties.name: Dialogue
properties.description: This spell depends on polite conversation, possibly with scones and tea, between wizard and daemon.

bindingofwindandgreen.name: Binding of Wind and Green
bindingofwindandgreen.description: The wizard traps mind and spirit (ka and ba) within a prison of their own perceptions.

ranks.effect: Wizard spends a week creating the seal, and the bond lasts an hour and a whisper.
Bond lasts a day and a night.
Bond lasts a week & a sunrise.
The bond lasts a month and a night and a dawn.
A year and a new moon.
A decade and an eclipse.
A century and a new king.

properties.name: Dialogue
properties.description: If the wizard wins, the target is bound to serve for the specified period. Failure: the seal crumbles to blood and dust.

properties.name: Faster
properties.description: Wizard pays double spell cost to craft the seal in a day. Double again to craft in an hour.

properties.name: Imbue
properties.description: The wizard’s life keeps the seal ready until it is used.

properties.name: No-summon
properties.description: Another spell may be required to bring a daemon.

properties.name: Seal
properties.description: Anchors the spell (1 stone). If the binding works, the target bears the seal in its body. When the spell ends, the seal crumbles to ash and salt.

properties.name: Weight of being
properties.description: Corporeal targets suffer [-] in dialogue.

blackfortressofthesoul.name: Black Fortress [of the Soul]
blackfortressofthesoul.flavor: What no one sees does not exist.
blackfortressofthesoul.description: The wizard traces a mandala upon the ground, then a second perpendicular mandala upon the air, then a third perpendicular to the first two. With each, they strip another layer of possible appearance from the space encompassed by the mandalas. At the last, they speak the no-word of the black fortress and the space within the mandalas becomes a no-space, impervious and imperceptible to creatures and forces that reside in the world of appearances. For creatures inside the no-space time and space, self and other do not exist. They exist in a state of simple nothing-thinking, protected from ageing and hunger and thirst. Non-sentient constructs or awakened entities can pass through the no-space as usual, though it does tickle and make them laugh (if they can). Creatures that can actually see the black fortress describe it as a no-thing of blackness, with light, time, and space sliding off its surface like water off a duck.

ranks.effect: The black fortress no-space is the size of a matchbox. Takes a tablespoon of sand and a minute to draw the mandala.
Large enough to hold a heart. A cup of sand and 10 minutes.
The size of a large trunk. A stone of sand and an hour.
As large as a simple wagon. A sack of sand and six hours.
The size of a chamber. A couple of sacks, dusk till dawn.
Big as a house. Five sacks and three days.
Big as a castle. Thirteen sacks and seventeen days.

properties.name: Imbue
properties.description: The fortress lives on the wizard’s trapped life essence.

properties.name: One-way time machine
properties.description: If the wizard creates the black fortress around themselves, they can use it to travel forward in time, as they can maintain the spell indefinitely.

bluescreenshield.name: Bluescreen Shield
bluescreenshield.description: The disenchanter weaves their electroplasm into a frothing nimbus of potential fantascience.

ranks.effect: The dancing nimbus negates one builder-tier attack (dealing 1d30 or more damage) or a spell of the 6th power or higher. Very hard test: shield stays up.
The shimmering nimbus negates one long-long-ago tier attack (1d20 or more damage) or a spell of the 5th power or higher. V. hard test to maintain.
The glimmering nimbus negates one long-ago tier attack (2d8 or more damage) or a spell of the 4th power or higher. Very hard test to maintain.
The stuttering nimbus negates one epic attack (1d12 or more damage) or a spell of the 3rd power or above. Hard to maintain.
The strobing nimbus negates one strong attack (1d8 or more damage) or a spell of the 2nd power or above. Hard to maintain.
The pulsing nimbus negates one moderate attack (1d4 or more damage) or a spell of the 1st power or above. Hard to maintain.
The scribbling nimbus negates one attack or a spell of any power. Moderate test to maintain.

properties.name: Imbue
properties.description: To keep the shield up.

properties.name: Superquick
properties.description: Raising the shield is a free action if the disenchanter is using a machine ghost.

bodyofsteel.name: Body of Steel
bodyofsteel.flavor: If they move, will they fall?
bodyofsteel.description: Through loud meditation and exercise, the wizard transforms a body into metal.

ranks.effect: Steel skin. Gains [+] vs light slashing and piercing damage.
Ferrous fat. [+] vs all melee and bullet damage.
Metal muscles. [+] to strength and endurance tests, [+] vs arrow damage, immune to piercing melee damage.
Biatomic bones. Ignores the first 5 points of damage from every source and [+] vs crits.
Iron mind. [+] vs all ka damage and ba damage from non-legal sources.

Heavy metal pot. The target’s body collapses into a pot-sized metal object. In this form it ignores another 5 points of damage from all sources, is immune to crits, and has [+] vs all damage. It also suffers [-] to  physical tests, as it only has its vibrational body to levitate and manipulate its environment.

Shining singularity. The target collapses into a glowing green metal sphere the size of a walnut. In this form it ignores another 10 points of damage from all sources and, if swallowed, held, or worn, it can dominate another creature with its iron will (moderate test).

properties.name: Cumulative
properties.description: Each power includes its lower-order effects.

properties.name: Imbued
properties.description: The target’s will keeps their iron body in shape.

properties.name: Magnetic
properties.description: Healed by electric effects that deal 20 damage or less.

bottledheroism.name: Bottled Heroism
bottledheroism.description: The wizard grabs a creature’s arm or other limb to steal its essence, its soul and personality, and trap it in a special flask (1 soap) for later use.

ranks.effect: Traps the soul of a level 1 (or lower) creature. A sip grants one trait or skill. Drinker gains a bonus to their rolls equal to the creature’s level.
Traps the soul of a level 2 (or lower creature). Sip grants two trait or skill ranks, and a bonus equal to creature’s level.
A soul of level 3 or lower. Sip grants 3 trait or skill ranks, plus bonus.
Level 4+ or lower, 4+ trait or skill ranks, bonus equal to level, etc.

properties.name: Ka attack
properties.description: Vs unwilling.

properties.name: Drink soul
properties.description: The wizard can drink a bottled soul to gain its power and abilities. A bottle is treated as a consumable, when it runs out the soul is spent. The soul is not destroyed in this manner—after drinking, it evaporates out of the wizard and seeks its body again.

properties.name: Imbue
properties.description: The wizard uses their vital force to hold the spell in place.

properties.name: Mere minutes
properties.description: A sip does not last.

properties.name: Nightmare catatonia
properties.description: So long as the entirety of its soul is in the flask, the victim cannot move, its ka-ba trapped in a magic prison.

properties.name: Recovery
properties.description: The victim tests endurance to awaken every time the wizard sips their trapped soul. However, they are weak and unsteady until their whole soul is drunk or poured out of the flask.

boundarydiscontinuity.name: Boundary Discontinuity
boundarydiscontinuity.description: By the application of supernal balance and perspective, the wizard tips a noumenon from one local maximum to another. In other words, they tip an object from one stable state to another.

ranks.effect: Entropy. Rock turns to sand, alcohol evaporates, ice melts.
Bistability. A rock becomes a liquid, a liquid polymer becomes a glass, a gas condenses into a rubbery fluid. Chemical composition may change to make transition possible.
Reverse the arrow. Rust turns to iron, exhaust condenses into fuel.
Discontinued matter. Ordinary matter is turned into paradoxic builder-stuff. One of its physical properties is wrong. For example, ice that is hot to the touch, or magma that is lighter than air.
Self-organizing matter. Dangerous. This power is interdicted. Do not create ice-9.

properties.name: Sudden
properties.description: A swift spell!

properties.name: Volume
properties.description: Spell normally affects a handful of matter per casting. Increasing the volume tenfold doubles the spell cost.

burdensharingarrangement.name: Burden Sharing Arrangement
burdensharingarrangement.description: The sanator undertakes a spiritual voyage into a creature’s essential existence to remove their burden. Some dress up the simple metem­psychic rite to justify higher fees.

ranks.effect: The sanator’s ka embarks on its voyage through the creature’s eyes or other primary sense organs. Over several hours they remove a burden from the target and convert it into a healer’s burden stored in an adjacent creature’s aura.
Rite takes about half an hour.
Rite takes a few minutes.
A dozen seconds.

properties.name: Healer’s Burden
properties.description: The sanator encysts a spirit stone in the aural body. It imposes [-] to all tests with one stat. It is otherwise harmless and dissipates without long-term damage to the bearer.

properties.name: Sloppy Transfer
properties.description: Rite is twice as quick, but deals 1d6 damage to both donor and recipient.

properties.name: Telemagic
properties.description: Radio healing.

properties.name: Transfer
properties.description: Preserves the sanator.

carpentierscancerbomb.name: Carpentier's Cancer Bomb
carpentierscancerbomb.description: The wizard spits on a creature and nano-daemons in their spittle rip open its source code.

ranks.effect: The target's flesh ripples and twitches for one round, then it tests endurance. If it fails, flailing keratin ropes and strangling muscular tentacles erupt from its skin. Each round, the target of the spell takes 2d6* ha damage, and the closest nearby creature suffers 1d8 ha damage. The target or an ally can attempt a tough endurance or strength test to rip the thing out of their body. The immature cancer bomb thing (L4, horror) dies within minutes of exposure to the atmosphere. If the thing kills the target, it crawls out fully adapted to its environment. The thing is never under the spell caster's control.
The tentacles and ropes erupt instantly. The target does not test endurance. The spell becomes #dangerous—if the wizard flubs the casting, the horror bursts out of their body instead.

properties.name: Born dying
properties.description: The thing begins to die as soon as it enters the world; only the wizard's imbued life force sustains it. Absent the seitas' life force, it permanently loses 1 life per hour. Once a day, at moon-rise, the wizard tests charisma. If they succeed, it becomes a perfect self-sustaining alien survivor. It is still not under the caster's control. Seriously, why let this monster live?

properties.name: Focus
properties.description: Until the thing is born.

properties.name: Horror
properties.description: Frightens fools.

channelchannel.name: Channel Channel
channelchannel.flavor: Every door opens in many ways.
channelchannel.description: The wizard meditates upon a door, a handle, a key, then opens it otherways and reveals another direction.

ranks.effect: It opens out of another adjacent portal.
Another nearby portal.
A faraway portal.
A portal at the edge of sight.
A memorized portal.
A well-described portal.
A legendary portal.

properties.name: Other dimension
properties.description: Opening a portal into another dimension doubles spell cost. Time may be a dimension.

chronicperception.name: Chronic Perception
chronicperception.flavor: To you a moment; to me years.
chronicperception.description: The wizard looks into the target’s eyes and speaks in a voice that modulates the frequencies of temporal perception. As long as the patient hears the voice, their perception of time is modified.

ranks.effect: Each moment feels half as long, everything around the target seems to move in a blur. Target loses half of their actions.

Each moment feels twice as long, the target can accomplish an additional mental action per round—their mind comes up with convincing reasons why they don’t want to accomplish an additional physical action.
Each moment feels like it passes many times faster. Target moves slowly as a snail, losing three quarters of their actions.

The target is flooded with adrenalin. Their hyper-focus gives them 2 additional mental actions per round and [+] to physical actions as their mind pushes their body past its limits. They lose 1 life every round they are accelerated and gain a burden of hurt when the spell ends.

Time stops moving for the patient. A perfect moment, stretching away. As long as they are not physically injured, they remain rooted in blissful contemplation of the experienced world. If they stay in this state for a full seven days, there is a chance they achieve enlightenment. In any case, they permanently gain 1 point of aura from their seven-day meditation on one single moment of existence.

The patient’s mind breaks through the veil of time, realizing the illusion of free will, seeing time and existence as a mountain range of predestination. If they succeed at an aura test, they gain 5 additional actions in a single round, then collapse unconscious. If they fail, they immediately suffer 1d4 aura damage and collapse unconscious.

properties.name: Focus
properties.description: Must keep talking.

properties.name: Ka attack
properties.description: Vs unwilling targets.

coherentillumination.name: Coherent Illumination
coherentillumination.description: The illuminos sculpts a focus matrix of airs and gestures that amplifies a light source, drawing in additional energies from surrounding matter to produce a beam of coherent light. A ray.

ranks.effect: Sets nearby flammables ablaze. Blinds distant creatures.
Blisters nearby skin (1d6 damage), scorches plastics, melts soft metals. Blinds very distant creatures.
Burns nearby objects (3d6 damage). Sets distant flammables ablaze. Blinds miles away.
5d6 damage to nearby.

properties.name: Aiming
properties.description: Illuminos tests to strike small or dodging targets.

properties.name: Crystal variation
properties.description: With different crystals, the illuminos can produce strange light rays from out of time and space. A blue crystal projects nauseating void rays, an acid UV crystal emits confusing rays, a neutral grey crystal jams machine logics, etc.

properties.name: Default
properties.description: Fire effects.

properties.name: Focus
properties.description: The ray continues to affect its target as long as the wizard focuses.

properties.name: Source
properties.description: Requires a light source, such as an electric candle.

consumption.name: Consumption
consumption.description: The kaliyat opens their third eye to reach into a nearby friend, ally, pet, or servant. They burn their victim’s life essence to fuel their magic.

ranks.effect: The victim loses 1d6 life and the kaliyat gains access to 1d6 + pro life for spell-casting.
Victim loses 2d6 life, kaliyat accesses 2d6 + pro life.
3d6 life for 3d6 + pro life.
Et cetera.

properties.name: Unwilling
properties.description: Spell costs double vs unwilling targets (ka attack).

properties.name: Siphon
properties.description: As the long as the wizard focusses, they can keep draining their target without further tests.

createcanonicalform.name: Create Canonical Form
createcanonicalform.description: The caster uses a blueprince scroll to assemble a golem, and their own life force to imbue it with motive ka. A workshop, tools, and materials are recommended. The work takes 1 week per golem level (min. 1 day for a 0-level noveltomaton).

ranks.effect: Build a tiny, insectile golem.
Toad or rat-sized.
Cat or dog-sized.
Human-sized.
Cow or bear-sized.
Megatherium-sized.
Big as a giant squid.
Flying statolith turtle-sized.

properties.name: Improvised
properties.description: A golem built without a suitable workshop, tools, or materials has halved (roll d6): (1) life, (2) mobility, (3) defense, (4) attack, (5) damage, or (6) just looks very poorly made.

createiksir.name: Create Iksir
createiksir.flavor: We shall be as gods again.
createiksir.description: The matter wizard creates pure white crystal form iksir from the zero point of creation itself. The required demiurgent protocols to make this process safe are considered lost.

ranks.effect: The wizard spends an hour creating one dose of iksir.
A day creating 2 doses.
A week creating 4 doses.
A month creating 8 doses.
A year creating 16 doses.

properties.name: Iksir boost
properties.description: The wizard spends a dose of iksir to triple the amount of iksir created or speed up the ritual by one order of magnitude.

delusionlock.name: Delusion Lock
delusionlock.description: The wizard riffles through a target’s mind for fears and hopes, dreams and worries, doubts and conflicts they can manipulate.

ranks.effect: Gentle. The target is soothed, sure that the wizard or another creature is harmless.
Inspire. The target loves the wizard or another creature, and gains [+] while helping them.
Enthrall. The target submits to the wizard or another creature, and follows their every command.
Bereft. Target is convinced they are worthless and suffers [-] to tests, unless they follow any other creature’s command.
Haunted. Target is convinced everyone is out to get them. They are hostile to all other creatures and suffer [-] to social tests or any tests to help other creatures.
Broken. Target is at war with itself. Voices from its past and future shout from all sides. It suffers [-] to all tests, confuses friends for enemies, and sees dire omens everywhere.
Locked. Target is trapped in its own mind. What battles does it fight? A dream voyage is required to tease it out again.

properties.name: Ka attack
properties.description: Vs unwilling targets.

properties.name: Life lock
properties.description: The target of a successful attack loses life equal to the spell’s power.

properties.name: Natural decay
properties.description: If the target has no contact with the wizard, the delusion decays on its own in a few weeks and the spell ends.

properties.name: Self-imbued
properties.description: Spell is imbued with the target’s own life.

doorsofperception.name: Doors of Perception
doorsofperception.flavor: See, it all makes sense now.
doorsofperception.description: The wizard closes their eyes and opens a door between their mind and another. Through the channel between, meanings can flow.

ranks.effect: Wizard connects to a mind directly, using a bi-neural cable.
A mind at arm’s length.
A nearby mind.
A faraway mind.
A mind seen, either by the naked eye or through a screen.
A mind unseen, but known.
A unknown, but well described. Requires a personal object to attune the aura.
Unknown, unconnected.

properties.name: Alien minds
properties.description: Double spell cost.

properties.name: Bi-neural cable
properties.description: A simple piece of gear, available from most radio autofacs. Used costs around €25.

properties.name: Swift link
properties.description: To communicate ten times faster than with speech, double spell cost (minimum 1).

draftblueprincescroll.name: Draft Blueprince Scroll
draftblueprincescroll.description: The caster translates a living creature into an analogous golem that will follow instruction lemmas implanted in its command unit. Completing a scroll takes 1d6 days of study and one day of meditative drafting. Masterful golem theorics can create a blueprince scroll without destroying the template creature, but this is a difficult feat.

ranks.effect: Caster drafts a blueprince for a golem based on a tiny creature. Perhaps a scorpion or a housefly, a perch or a jellyfish.
A small creature. Toad, rat, thrush, or apple.
A cat or dog-sized creature.
Chimpanzee or human-sized.
Horse or aurochs-sized.
Elephant or triceratop-sized.
Big as a sea whale.
Big as a void mosasaur.

properties.name: Ctrl+V
properties.description: A scroll can be used with a spell like Create Canonical Form to produce golems ad nauseam.

echoesofthefleshchoir.name: Echoes of the Flesh Choir
echoesofthefleshchoir.flavor: All carbon-based life was once one. The old architects spun fleshworlds out of the void, and bade their trusted chitin-clad shepherds to thresh new creations from the heaving slime. This is but a shred of their old harvest song.
echoesofthefleshchoir.description: Emit the special harmonic frequencies that inspire microorganisms to gather together, forming distributed biological nanofactories.

ranks.effect: Grow a new organ or limb attached to target.
Create a duplicate of target creature, with no items or memories.

properties.name: Bio-shock
properties.description: Facing such sudden change, the target must make a medium END test or fall into shock.

properties.name: Imbue
properties.description: The wizard holds the spell effects together through ancient will. Pay the spell cost again to make the changes permanent.

electromagicalprojector.name: Electromagical Projector
electromagicalprojector.description: The wizard makes the three gestures and collapses into an electro-magnificent wave-particle that travels like lightning to a nearby location, where they violently reassemble. If the target is sentient, the wizard makes a ka attack. If they miss, they reassemble next to their target.

ranks.effect: Each creature in the wizard's path suffers 2d6 electromagical damage. Every creature next to the reassembly point takes 4d6 damage. If the hero reassembles within a solid target, they both suffer 8d6 damage.
Can use reflective surfaces to change direction.
Transmits to a location or target far away.
Deals 3d6 damage in path, 6d6 to creatures next to reassembly point, and 12d6 within a solid target.
Can reflect off a storm cloud.

properties.name: Oh-mega
properties.description: Uses the rods to direct the sizzling bolts.

electromagnificentdetector.name: Electromagnificent Detector
electromagnificentdetector.description: Over several hours the wizard paints a net of symbols on a stone-sized object—perhaps a small stone tablet or a compass. While they imbue this object with their life force and have it on, or very near, their person, the wizard’s senses expand beyond their normal range. Hiding the item in a pocket or other container may ‘blind’ it.

ranks.effect: The object replicates the senses of a creature similar to the wizard. Perhaps the keen ears of a fennec fox, the electric detection of an eel, or the piercing eyes of a falcon.
It senses strange spectra and chroma no mortal could detect, from radio waves to the deep flesh-eating plinking of hard radioactivity or the bass line of gravity pulses.
The wizard can detect the information substrate of the world, the life signs of ha weaving through the Given World, the ka spirits flitting between, the reality dysfunctions perpetrated by magics.

properties.name: Focus
properties.description: When the wizard’s attention wanders, they no longer see through their eye-stone.

properties.name: Small anchor
properties.description: A painted eye. Soap-sized.

electromagnificentdiscordion.name: Electromagnificent Discordion
electromagnificentdiscordion.description: The electric wizard waves their oh-mega rods in strange designs over a diagram of wires and crystals (many wizards prepare this diagram in advance, sewing it onto a cloth or parchment).  When they touch the rods together, they amplify a vibrant field of disruption into existence.

ranks.effect: Adjacent electromagical communications blocked. Electric creatures nauseated [-].
Field expands, covering a small area. Adjacent electricals and synthetics suffer 1 mental stat damage per round.
Field encompasses a large area. Adjacent electricals suffer 2 stat damage per round. Nearby golems and ka spirits are also nauseated [-].
Electricals suffer 4 stat damage. Golems and ka spirits suffer 1 stat damage.
Damage double again.

properties.name: Focus
properties.description: The hum continues as long as the electric wizard waves their oh-mega rod.

energyaccumulator.name: Energy Accumulator
energyaccumulator.description: The caster traces strange diagrams on the air for several minutes to imbue a physical object with environmental ka, holding it in place with their will. This energy can be released slowly, powering machinery or golems, or swiftly, creating explosions. The energy is drained from the caster’s surroundings, which can cause crops to wither and cows to stop giving milk.

ranks.effect: The caster imbues a chickpea-sized object with a tenth-unit of energy. It provides the equivalent of a sub-baseline human’s hourly labour. Suddenly released, it deals 2d6 ha damage to all in a small radius.
Caster imbues an egg-sized object with a unit of energy. It provides the equivalent of a baseline human’s daily labour. Swiftly released, it deals 3d6 ha damage to all in a medium radius.
Stone-sized object with ten units of energy. Released, deals 5d6 damage in a medium radius.
Sack-sized object with 100 units of energy. 8d6 damage in a medium radius. More closer to the object. Less farther out.
Shipment-sized object with 1,000 units of energy. If suddenly released, it is as destructive as a traditional ton of the oldtech explosive called ‘teent’. It deals 13d6 damage in a medium area.

essentialappetite.name: Essential Appetite
essentialappetite.flavor: Eat its heart, gain its courage.
essentialappetite.description: The wizard consumes the flesh and blood of a creature to acquire its attributes.

ranks.effect: Similarity: the mane of a lion, pebbly snake-like skin, bunny ears. [+] to social interactions with that type of creature.
Senses: the smell of a shark, the hearing of an elf.
Aptitude: the brachiation of an ape, the leaping of a kangaroo, the flight of an albatross. May include natural attacks.
Trait: the semi-magical ability of an individual creature. E.g., a hero’s Break the Weak trait.

properties.name: Imbue
properties.description: When the wizard ends the spell, the organ is flushed out in a mess of spell-flesh.

properties.name: Living source
properties.description: Spell price halved if consuming a pound of living flesh, dealing 1d6 ha damage.

properties.name: Organ
properties.description: Each attribute (or trait) manifests as a 1 stone organ on or in the wizard’s body. Removal is painless, though it may be gory.

properties.name: Symbolic
properties.description: Spell price doubled if wizard consumes a symbolic representation of the creature, rather than its actual flesh. Creature cookies are popular.

evivification.name: E-Vivification
evivification.flavor: A new, better kind of life!
evivification.description: The wizard jams their oh-mega rods into the yielding flesh of a motionless body and forces an electric ka elemental into this flesh prison. The ritual takes several minutes to create a creature under their control.

ranks.effect: The hero e-vivifies a cat or dog-sized body, creating a Level 1 electric abomination (sparkling, twitching, drooling).
The hero e-vivifies a pig- or human-sized body, creating an L2 abomination (rumbling, blistering, sizzling).
A cow- or horse-sized body, for an L4 abomination (rippling, bloating, searing).
A rhino- or hippo-sized body, for an L8 abomination (thundering, stomping, flashing).

properties.name: Dangerous
properties.description: What? Really?

properties.name: Imbue
properties.description: Life to maintain control.

properties.name: Living body
properties.description: If the wizard uses a living body, it should ideally be bound to an electrically resistive slab with solid straps. The living target undergoes a painful, terminal procedure, losing 1 life per minute until dead. All life lost this way is added to the e-vivified abomination’s usual life total. Most inquisitors agree using this spell on a living creature is a vile offence against sapience.

properties.name: Oh-mega
properties.description: Needs the rods.

extractiksir.name: Extract Iksir
extractiksir.flavor: Fossil gods will fuel our dreams.
extractiksir.description: The matter wizard uses an opus box and the exemplar protocols to extract iksir and refine it into stable red powder form.

ranks.effect: The wizard spends an hour refining one dose of iksir.
A day refining 3 doses.
A week refining 9 doses.
A month refining 27 doses.

properties.name: Iksir dose (item)
properties.description: The extracted iksir is entangled with the wiz-ard’s essence. They recover their imbued life force after using up all the iksir.

properties.name: Six sources
properties.description: The six accepted sources of iksir are:

fearitself.name: Fear Itself
fearitself.description: The wizard channels their life force directly into a target’s fears, giving them the ability to affect the physical world.

ranks.effect: The fear crawls out of the subconscious and assaults like a flickering shadow (L1, +3 1d6 ka, psychic lash).
It grows larger (L2, +4 1d6 ba, wave of guilt). Its attacks can afflict up to three creatures near the victim at once.
It becomes solid (L3, +6 1d10 ha or 1 aura, ogrish paw).
It manifests as a swirling maelstrom of dust (L4) and can strike creatures in a large area around the target.
It looms like a thin, hungry ogre (L5, +8 2d8 ba or 1d4 cha, clammy, guilty clench).
It can manifest as a radiation ghost (L6) and attack as far away as the patient can see.
It grows huge, a mass of writhing electronic tentacles and faces (L7, +10 2d12 ka or 1d4 aura and thought, shocking revelation of insignificance).
It manifests as a departed friend (L8) as far as the target can imagine.

fiatlux.name: Fiat Lux
fiatlux.description: The mulmullu creates light from their own body.

ranks.effect: The light has a brightness of 10 lumens. Like a weak lamp.
100 lumens. A basic lamp.
1000 lumens. Very bright.
10,000 lumens. A blindingly bright lamp. 1d4 damage/round to all nearby at full spectrum.
100k lumens. The light causes permanent blindness and overloads circuits. Dangerous. 4d4* damage/round to all far away and nearby at full spectrum.
1 million lumens. Very dangerous. 4d4*d4* damage/round to all far away and nearby at full spectrum.

properties.name: Crystal variation
properties.description: See above.

properties.name: Default
properties.description: Clear (comm) effects.

properties.name: Full spectrum
properties.description: Double spell cost: the emitted light covers the full EM spectrum and deals serious tissue damage. Victims may suffer magical corruption.

properties.name: Flaring imbue IV
properties.description: The light burns on as long as the spell is imbued. If the spell cost was more than 4, the wizard tests aura or endurance each round. Success: they pay an additional 1d4* life; Fail: pay the full spell cost again.

properties.name: Project
properties.description: For 1 additional spell cost, the light blazes from a nearby target. For 2, it shines from a faraway target. For 3, it radiates from a distant target the wizard can still see clearly.

foldforce.name: Fold Force
foldforce.flavor: Reality twisted is a bent bow.
foldforce.description: The barrerante takes one of the fundamental forces they manipulate and bends it to their use.

ranks.effect: Nudge. The barrerante slightly nudges the vector of a force. Gravity tilts, electromagnetic charge shifts, bosons leap, love … is love a fundamental force? This might mean [-] or [+] for a long range missile, a glitch in an EM message, or a stutter in a reaction.
Turn. The local vector makes a large shift (30° to 60°). Gravity feels wonky. Projectiles miss until attackers compensate, electronic systems desynchronize.
Bend. Vector redirects by 60° to 120°. Furniture falls sideways as gravity rotates, sunlight turns aside creating a cone of darkness.

Fold. Vector swings by 120° to 240°. Up becomes down, positive goes negative, light fades to dark. A barrerante could concentrate and swiftly fold gravity around them to give the impression that they (and possibly their easy chair, side table, teapot, and lamp) are flying.
Enfold. Vector flips around by 240° to 480°, tying itself in a loop. A goblin trapped in a gravity loop accelerates to terminal velocity, electricity coils into ball lightning.

properties.name: Falling damage
properties.description: This spell creates environmental hazards.

properties.name: Focus
properties.description: Intense attention to maintain an effect over time.

properties.name: Fold spell
properties.description: The barrerante can redirect a spell cast by another wizard. To do so, they increase the power cost of the fold force spell by the power of the other magic. For extras’ magical attacks, the TC estimates the power (see Setting Spell Power For New Spells, pXX). For example, bending (P2) a P3 Electromagical Projector would have a power cost of P2 + P3 = 5.

properties.name: Modulate
properties.description: The barrerante can double the power cost to adjust a forces carrier signal. They can double or halve the strength of a fundamental force within the affected area. If modulating another spell, this doubles or halves its effect.

properties.name: Small area
properties.description: Affects a small area around the barrerante. Affecting a large area doubles the power cost.

properties.name: Wall-runner
properties.description: Everyone, including the barrerante, suffers [-] to running, fighting, leaping, and other dynamic actions in a modified fundamental force effect. It’s just weird to the human brain.

forestssymbiote.name: Forest’s Symbiote
forestssymbiote.description: By ingesting part of a plant or fungus and meditating upon its essence, the pooli sunglé merges with it at a cellular level.

ranks.effect: The pooli knows perfectly what a plant needs to flourish.
The pooli gains a weak trait from the plant, perhaps photosynthesis to halve their food needs, bark-like skin to grant +2 ha, or succulent skin to halve water loss in a desert.
The pooli gains a stronger trait. Photosynthesis feeds them with edible fruits leftover, woody platelets grants +5 ha, iron-wood thorns deal 2d8 damage to any melee atackers.

Gains a powerful trait. They can feed a small community with the tubers that grow on their back, can assume the form of an ambulatory war mushroom with +9 ha and chitin flails that deal 3d8 damage each, and so on.
Turns into a fine redwood or vast mycelium to travel through time, ageless and proud.

properties.name: Imbue
properties.description: While life flows into the spell, its effect persists.

fountainzero.name: Fountain Zero
fountainzero.description: The tabattalger’s mind unrolls a nearby point of force, creating a tennis-ball-sized fountain of energy. Favourite starters include batteries, lighters, or firecrackers.

ranks.effect: Energizer. A dim red ball. Adjacent creatures gain [+] to energy attacks.
Burner. A bright yellow ball. Adjacent creatures suffer 2d8 damage, batteries and energy weapons test vs overload.
Flare. A blinding green ball. Adjacent creatures suffer 4d8 damage, batteries and energy weapons explode for 2d8 damage, force shields suffer 6d8 damage.
Warp. A mind-bending blue ball. Adjacent creatures suffer 6d8 damage, force shields suffer 12d8 damage. Nearby power sources explode for 2d8 damage.

Gateway. An eye-burning ultraviolet ball. Adjacent creatures suffer 6d8 damage, force shields suffer 18d8 damage. Far away power sources explode for 2d8 damage. Ending the spell cast at this power or higher is always dangerous. After a few minutes, and every hour thereafter, there is a 1-in-6 chance a thing of luminous chaos (L=Px2, ineffable, burning, awesome) enters through the fountain. It is alien and deadly but not hostile, unless provoked.

properties.name: Easily dangerous
properties.description: Double power when comparing to character level.

properties.name: Folds easily
properties.description: Folding this spell does not increase the power cost of a Fold Force spell.

properties.name: Force fountain • Undifferentiated energies spill out of the fountain
Imbue
properties.description: The tabattalger’s life keeps the fountain open.

fourpointhold.name: Four-Point Hold
fourpointhold.description: The feniksan uses their immaterial third hand to tease out a nucleus of force from an object’s core. Stretching this force string, they can anchor the nucleus to up to four other physical objects. Once locked in this way, the object is immobile—even if suspended in mid-air. A pyramidal arrangement is the usual way to create a floating rock or island.

ranks.effect: The force strings can be no longer than a handsbreadth.
Up to a metre long.
Up to 10 metres.
100 metres (~100 Vastlands yards).
1 kilometre (~1 Vastlands mile).

properties.name: Drag
properties.description: The feniksan must physi­cally haul the force-string, like a spider with its thread.

properties.name: Optional imbue
properties.description: If the feniksan does not imbue the forcestring, it slowly evaporates. The thinner the string, the faster the evaporation.

properties.name: Razorforce
properties.description: The feniksan decides the thickness of the forcestrings, from as wide as their third hand can grasp, to thinner than the sharpest razor. Regardless, the forcestring is unbreakable.

properties.name: Razortrap
properties.description: Each sharp forcestring deals ~1d8 ha damage and severs limbs or heads on a critical roll. Speed and circumstance may modify this damage.

golemdeconstruction.name: Golem Deconstruction
golemdeconstruction.description: The caster reaches into a golem’s lemma banks with their mind and tries to break them down. This breakdown may be explosive.

ranks.effect: It suffers 1d12 ba or ha damage.
1d20 ba or ha damage.
2d20 ba or ha damage to the golem, 2d6 ha dmg to all nearby.
3d20 ba or ha damage to the golem, 4d6 ha damage to all in a medium radius.
4d20 ba or ha damage to the golem, 8d6 ha damage to all in a large radius.

properties.name: Per definitionem
properties.description: Where is the line between human and golem?

greatmagneticfield.name: Great Magnetic Field
greatmagneticfield.description: The bardingast’s muscles interlace with the electromagnetic fields in a small area, amplifying them, playing them like music.

ranks.effect: Horripilation. Dread unease fills the air. A tremor of anticipation. All creatures suffer [-] vs ba and ka attacks.
Buzzing. Tastes of metal and ash. [-] to fine motor skills. Synthetics also suffer 1d6 ka damage & memory loss each round.
Brake. Wizard restricts the movement of smallish metal objects in the field. [-] to all tests with metal tools. Synthetics suffer 2d6 ka damage per round.
Wield. Stone-sized or smaller metal objects follow the wizard’s command. Each round: 1d6 ha damage to all creatures in the area, synthetics suffer an additional 3d6 ka damage.
Whirl. Metal items turn into a maelstrom of destruction. Each round: 3d6 ha damage to all creatures, 4d6 ka to synthetics.

properties.name: Contract
properties.description: Halve spell price (minimum 1) to focus effect on a single metal object. Only affects a single target it is in contact with.

properties.name: Expand
properties.description: Double spell price to affect a large area. Quadruple for a very large area.

properties.name: Focus
properties.description: As long as the wizard flexes, the magnetics sing.

properties.name: Move
properties.description: Moving the area of effect is a 1 power extra spell flex.

headbanger.name: Headbanger
headbanger.description: The sonovor is the conduit of an angry, angsty demiurge, a thunder from the sky sworn to fight and die, an inspiration of destruction, pain and cheese. No scholar of the magics has yet figured out what’s up with the cheese, but it’s tradition, so best to play along.

ranks.effect: In spirit. The wizard spends one hero die, the target gains a hero die and increases it one step.
In deed. Hero dice of nearby allies are twice as effective.
In glory. The wizard spends one hero die, every nearby ally gains a hero die and increases it.
In bravery. Hero dice spent charging into battle are thrice as effective.
In flight. Spends 1 HD: all nearby allies can trample their opponents, gain 1 HD and increase it.
Wall of death. Any ally injured this round gains 1 HD.

properties.name: Cumulative
properties.description: Each power gives access to its lower-order effects.

properties.name: Focus
properties.description: The sonovor keeps the channels roaring as energy flows through them. Each round, the sonovor can spend one hero die for additional effects.

properties.name: Inspiration
properties.description: As long as the channels are open, all nearby allies gain +X to all rolls, where X is the power of the spell.

healingsleep.name: Healing Sleep
healingsleep.flavor: Where did you dream last night?
healingsleep.description: The wizard performs an hour-long rite to douse the patient's aura and send their essential hakaba code through the gates of horn and ivory to heal in the presence of the oneiroi Quiescus and Sanatos. A patient could be mistaken for dead while their aura is doused. When the code returns to their incarnation, they awaken refreshed, and they recover one attribute or one of their burdens dissipates.

ranks.effect: The target is helpless, nigh-soulless, for three days & nights.
The target is helpless for a day and a night.
Helpless for six hours.
Helpless for an hour.

properties.name: Many sleeps
properties.description: The wissa can cast multiple instances of healing sleep on the same target at the same time to restore multiple attributes or remove multiple burdens. However, the price of each subsequent casting is increased by 1 of each sleep already cast.

properties.name: Offensive sleep
properties.description: If the target is unwilling, it gets an easy aura or endurance test to resist the spell.

properties.name: Telemagic
properties.description: Initially developed to reduce costs to insurers.

holeintime.name: Hole In Time
holeintime.flavor: Kick a hole right in the sky.
holeintime.description: Between one step and the next, the voidwalker flickers between existence and non-existence. Where did they voyage in the time between heartbeats?

ranks.effect: The voidwalker ages a day and gains [+] to one test. If the test is moderate or easier, they succeed automatically. They have already succeeded so many times in so many worlds.
The voidwalker ages a week and has in their possession a helpful mundane object or simple information, such as a password or written directions.
The voidwalker ages a month and has a rare object or complex information, such as a map or instruction manual.

The voidwalker ages a year, and a person or town that did not know them before now knows and trusts them. They have spent many days and nights together, the walker coming and going, a fond visitor over the years.

properties.name: Dangerous
properties.description: Don’t play with it.

properties.name: Null
properties.description: It’s just reality.

ignoranceisbliss.name: Ignorance [is Bliss]
ignoranceisbliss.flavor: You see what you want to see.
ignoranceisbliss.description: The wizard chants quietly and plays a strange melody. Their target feels soothed and at ease, their mind gently filling in the world around them with what they want to see. As long as the wizard chants, the patient’s perception of reality remains sweetly comforting. After, the patient only remembers their perception, not what they might have really experienced.

ranks.effect: A target overlooks something distressing. Someone afraid of heights ignores the height of a ledge. A scared guard ignores a night-clad assassin walking past.
Target does not experience pain. A visit to the dentist passes in a haze of pleasant chit-chat.

Target passes time in solipsistic comfort, unaware of the world around them. Rough ground feels like silken mattresses, sand tastes like cake, a high drop is a staircase leading down to a pleasure garden.
Target completely dissociates from the world and enters a luxury palace of their sweetest dreams. After a day in this state, they get a week’s rest.

properties.name: Focus
properties.description: Gotta be doing it.

properties.name: Group ignorance
properties.description: Spell price increases by 3 to delude targets equal to the wizard’s level.

properties.name: Ka attack
properties.description: Vs unwilling targets.

imagoreplay.name: Imago Replay
imagoreplay.description: The nura dawa uses their mind to record a scene or object, creating an imago anchor. Fully recording a 3d representation takes a few minutes. Recording a whole scene may take longer.

ranks.effect: The wizard replays a scene or object they could encompass with arms outstretched.
A scene or object to fill a whole chamber.
The scene stretches as far as the wizard could throw a stone.
As far as an arrow flies.
As far as the eye can see.

properties.name: Default
properties.description: Clear (comm) effects.

properties.name: Hard light
properties.description: Double spell price to make the imago as durable as liquid water (ludu 3). Double again for completely impermeable light (ludu 4).

properties.name: Imago anchor
properties.description: A poly-dimensional representation in the caster’s mind. 1 stone.

properties.name: Living focus
properties.description: One action: caster makes the imago move with a semblance of life for that round.

incarnatelabourer.name: Incarnate Labourer
incarnatelabourer.description: The summoner spends a few hours detailing a homely, inviting diagram. Next, they sacrifice a small animal or potted plant to incarnate a ‘helpful’ daemon.

ranks.effect: The hopeful daemon (L0, incompetent) is the size of a pot-bellied pig, with six prehensile tentacles on its tummy. It is suitable for unskilled labour.
The helpful daemon (L0, uncanny) is the size of a middling dog, with six-fingered human hands on each paw and a prehen­sile tail. It is a master of one skill.

The precocious daemon (L1, unearthly) is the size of a store dummy masquerading as a person, with eyes of fire and detachable floating hands. Besides mastery of one skill, it has a supernormal ability, such as (d6): (1) levitation, (2) understanding many languages, (3) seeing in the dark, (4) breathing water, (5) speaking to animals, or (6) mimicking any sound.
The heavy daemon (L2, plodding) can also carry loads like an ox, break gates like a bull, plough fields like a draft horse, or build walls like a confab servitor.
The thorny daemon (L3, slippery) is like a cross between a scarecrow and a shrike. Besides the previous abilities, its ethereal blades go snicker-snack and its beak can pluck out hearts.
The thoughtful daemon (L4, zu) is like a snake with wings and three gemstone heads. It is also psychokinetic, telepathic, and wise in strange, twisted ways.

indivisiblecleaver.name: Indivisible Cleaver
indivisiblecleaver.description: The wizard uses the protocols of the ten translations to reach into the indivisible heart of a material object and break it. This releases creative forces, which can be rather destructive.

ranks.effect: The wizard caresses a soap-sized material object and causes it to break down over one hour. First, it is weakened, then it fractures, eventually it crumbles into dust or even sublimates.
The breakdown happens in a minute, releasing significant heat that sets flammable objects on fire and deals 1 ha damage to adjacent creatures each round.
The breakdown happens in a second. The object explodes violently and showers nearby creatures with shrapnel (1d6 ha damage). Adjacent creatures suffer double damage.
The breakdown happens in a sixtieth of a second. The explosion is more violent and deals 3d6 ha damage to nearby creatures, double to adjacent.
Even faster. The fireball excavates a crater, deals 8d6 damage to nearby creatures, double to adjacent.

Horribly fast. The object breaks down in one 216,000th of a second, and within a milli-second the fireball is tens of metres across. By 100 milli-seconds, it measures hundreds of metres. Using dice to simulate damage is pointless. The crater continues to glow with spell radiance for days, and the source codes of living creatures in the vicinity continue to be corrupted for weeks or months.

properties.name: Iksir modification
properties.description: The wizard can use a dose of iksir to delay the spell's trigger by a minute or so, as well as all the usual iksir mods.

properties.name: Living objects
properties.description: The wizard needs to make a ha attack to touch an unwilling creature and trigger the indivisible cleaver within its physical form. The unfortunate target suffers quadruple damage from the spell.

interpretationofempire.name: Interpretation of Empire
interpretationofempire.description: The receiver uses the canonical libraries to interpret the omens and navigate the future.

ranks.effect: Necessary pain. The next time a willing target suffers damage, they gain that amount as a bonus to a subsequent roll.
Promised path. As long as the target does not deviate from their path, they gain [+] to one roll per round.
Omen ward. As long as the target does not rebel against their destiny (as interpreted by the wizard), they gain [+] vs attacks.
Oath’s fortune. The target speaks and oath and the mark imbues the target’s life force in an item. The item gains that amount as a bonus to all rolls, unless the target breaks its oath.
Different destiny. If the target is slain, the mark revives them five days and nights later, restored with the life force imbued in the mark.

Prophecied. The target accepts a quest. As long as they follow the quest, the omens guide them, granting a special skill [R3]  called ‘prophecy’ and a special seventh stat called ‘omen’ [5]. When relevant, the target can rely on the strength of their omen and the righteousness of their prophecy to prevail. The skill and stat each take up a skill or trait slot.
Doom. Until the target faces their fated opponent, they cannot die. Even though slain, they return—a logos revenant.

properties.name: Ka attack
properties.description: If a soul is unwilling.

properties.name: Mark
properties.description: The wizard marks (1 st) a target with the interpretation in bone ash and blood ink. The mark may be imbued with the wizard’s or the target’s life force.

invitationrider.name: Invitation Rider
invitationrider.description: The wizard spends a few hours painting imbued diagrams on a creature with the four black inks and the six celestial tints. They may paint the diagrams on themselves. When the wizard activates the diagram, a daemon rushes in to possess the creature.

ranks.effect: The creature’s eyes flare with the daemon’s favourite colour. The daemon grants [+] to all tests using one of the creature’s skills or stats.
A halo rings the creature’s head. It gains [+] to tests and effects with two skills or stats.
Cilia of light ripple across the creature’s body. It gains [+] to tests and effects with three skills or stats. Also, it gains resistance [+] vs all ha, ka, or ba damage.
A shifting aura of many colours bathes the creature. It gains all previous effects and any supernatural ability or trait of the summoner’s choice.

Luminous rainbow dust swirls off the creature. It is very visible on any magitechnical detector. It gains all previous effects. Also, all its physical stats become 6, and any weapon it holds is wreathed in energy. The weapon’s damage dice increase 1 step, and it can fire bolts of daemonic energy (1d12, explosive).

properties.name: Dangerous
properties.description: Of course it is.

properties.name: Dialogue
properties.description: To choose a daemon & convince it to leave at the end.

properties.name: Feeling lucky
properties.description: A daemon from the simple generator possesses the target. The wizard must pay an additional spell cost to ensure a manageable daemon manifests. The additional cost is equal to the desired daemon’s level.

properties.name: Imbue
properties.description: Effective as long as the diagrams remain imbued.

properties.name: Welcome overstayed
properties.description: When the spell ends, the wizard still has to convince the daemon to leave. As soon as the spell ends, the posses­sed creature loses all the benefits granted by the daemon.

lemmahack.name: Lemma Hack
lemmahack.description: Once the wizard gains access to the machine’s core processing unit they can modify its lemmas, gaining control over its basic and advanced functions. The ritual lasts about a quarter of an hour and involves the waving of wands and plugging of cables.

ranks.effect: The wizard can read the golem’s memory banks and learn what it has done.
The wizard can insert a repeater lemma to perceive through the golem’s senses. The wizard needs a receiver to decode the signal.
The wizard can rewrite lemmas, giving new commands, ending previous commands, or creating exceptions—for example, the golem might no longer perceive the wizard or their friends.
The wizard infects the golem with a control gremlin, gaining direct control golem directly, action for action. Imbue control gremlin: control lasts until gremlin exorcised.

properties.name: Focus
properties.description: Is required to maintain effects for more than one turn.

properties.name: Practical
properties.description: This is a key spell of the practical school.

livingmetal.name: Living Metal
livingmetal.description: Screaming like a metal banshee, the geldringer awakens a metal object. It dances to their tune.

ranks.effect: One soap or smaller. Perhaps a coin or a needle.
One stone or smaller. A sword, mace, or gun.
One sack or less. A tower shield or a suit of armour.
One shipment (10 sacks or less). A small car or a portcullis.
Ten shipments (100 sacks). That’s roughly 10 tons. A truck? Two trucks?
100 tons or so.

properties.name: Free-will
properties.description: Granting the item faux intelligence doubles the spell cost. It uses the wizard’s attributes.

properties.name: Imbued
properties.description: The wizard’s will keeps the metal thing moving.

properties.name: Maglev
properties.description: The metal item levitates on a field of pure magnetic will.

machineimmaterial.name: Machine Immaterial
machineimmaterial.flavor: A constructed thing for all to fear.
machineimmaterial.description: The fortokampin accesses the integral asset library of creation to mold pure force into a machine by tracing it into being with their second and third hands.

ranks.effect: The forto spends a few minutes to create a simple machine of pure force: a wedge, lever, or wheel.

A quarter of an hour creating a force-field mechanism linking of four to six bars and joints. Provided power, this can perform work, like pumping, walking, manipulating, and other early industrial tasks.
An hour to create an engine or actuator out of pure, condensed forcefields.
A complex machine with a homeostatic or other logical controller, capable of performing set tasks.
A self-organizing machine that adapts to its circumstances and performs set tasks with an eerie parody of intelligence.

An intelligent forcefield machine capable of self-replication. Ending the spell cast at this power or higher is always dangerous. Warning! Casting at this spell power may unleash a murderous sentient forcefield machine (L=P, self-repairing, replicating, synthetic) on the world!

properties.name: Fathom
properties.description: The machine fits within the character’s outstretched arms. Twice the size, twice the cost.

properties.name: Imbue
properties.description: Without the forto’s life, the machine decoheres.

magnificenthiddenpalace.name: Magnificent Hidden Palace
magnificenthiddenpalace.description: The caster spends a few seconds swirling their arms and hands and feet in ellipses, suddenly tracing glowing afterimages in the air, then steps through an afterimage into a mental palace, safe from all harm.

ranks.effect: The wizard disappears inside for about a minute. Extreme exit test.
Vanishes for about an hour. Hard exit test.
About a day. Moderate test.
A week. Easy test.
A month. Trivial test.
A year. Automatic.
Decade.
Lifetime.
Seven lifetimes.

properties.name: Early exit
properties.description: Wizard’s discretion.

properties.name: Guests
properties.description: The wizard can pull guests along into the palace. The spell price is multiplied by the number of people entering.

properties.name: Imbue
properties.description: The wizard’s life force is locked to keep the exit open.

properties.name: Memory palace
properties.description: If the wizard has the memory palace trait, they can enter their own palace. While there, they do not age.

manybodiedcollective.name: Manybodied Collective
manybodiedcollective.description: The wizard multiplies their consciousness and bodies. After all, it takes a village to survive an armaggedon level event. By injecting a target creature with their cerebrospinal fluid, the wizard adds it to their collective.

ranks.effect: A tiny body, such as a mouse or bird or beetle joins the hive.
A small body, perhaps a cat, carp, or capybara.
A humannish body. A man, bear, or pig. Perhaps a porpoise.
A large body, such as a moose, quetzalcoatl, or orca.
A great body, such as a whale or brontotherium.

properties.name: Collective
properties.description: The new body’s spirit and personality (ka and ba) are quiescent within the collective. If their memories are directly accessed, for example their skills or knowledge of a password, a contest ensues. If the body succeeds, it breaks free of the hive spell.

properties.name: Community
properties.description: The multiple bodies still have individual personalities and quirks, but function for the overriding good of the collective hive as dictated by the identity anchors.

properties.name: Control
properties.description: When a new body has a higher sum of mental attributes than the wizard, a contest for control ensues. Some wizards have lost themselves this way.

properties.name: Imbue
properties.description: The new body may be imbued with its own life force, or the life force of the original body.

properties.name: Identity anchor
properties.description: Each body requires a 1 stone organic anchor to connect with every other body. Larger hives may adopt a cellular or hub-and-spoke network. Smaller or larger bodies have suitably sized anchors.

properties.name: Ka attack
properties.description: If a body is unwilling.

properties.name: Sharing
properties.description: The hive communicates directly through the noösphere. Focusing on the sensory experiences of an individual body, apart from the wizard’s original body, takes an action.

materialmetatropy.name: Material Metatropy
materialmetatropy.description: The matterite magician uses the protocols of the eight keys to modify one attribute of a physical (ha) object; doubling or halving (or otherwise significantly altering) its mass, volume, temperature, density, colour, conductivity, malleability, or lustre of a material (ha) object without modifying its underlying chemical composition.

ranks.effect: The magician spends a week to modify a handful of matter.
The magician spends a day to modify a handful.
An hour to modify a handful.
A minute for a handful.

properties.name: Bulk metatropy
properties.description: Modifying a bucketful of matter doubles the spell’s power cost. A sackful triples the spell’s power.

properties.name: Iksir boost
properties.description: A dose of iksir lets the wizard change an additional attribute during the same ritual, speed up the modification, or increase the bulk.

properties.name: Iksir permanence
properties.description: Spending doses of iksir equal to the spell’s power makes the modification permanent.

properties.name: Imbue
properties.description: The matter remains modified so long as it is imbued with the essence spent by the caster.

measureofjustice.name: Measure of Justice
measureofjustice.description: The wizard uses their cubit des archives to make things right and dispense judgements.

ranks.effect: The cubit changes shape, like wax, becoming a more suitable shape, such as a key, cup, or mirror. If shaped into a weapon, its damage dice increase one step.

The cubit is wreathed in purifying flames. It deals normal damage to otherwise immune creatures, including disease demons and possessive spirits. It may set objects on fires. Unclean creatures suffer double damage.

properties.name: Imbue
properties.description: Active with life.

properties.name: Rich
properties.description: A rightmaker may simultaneously imbue a correct and official cubit des archives with multiple measures (P1 to P8) from the list. Each measure requires a separate casting.

metalsteeliron weapon.name: Metal Steel Iron Weapon
metalsteeliron weapon.description: The trampetchi’s growls, grunts, and groans infuse a metal weapon (or lump) with magic potential.

ranks.effect: A magnetic soul is bound to the weapon. It is now a magic weapon. No modifiers though.
Weapon gains wizard’s pro to attack and damage rolls.
Weapon’s critical multiplier increases by the wizard’s pro.
It glows with all fire, cutting through all non-metal substances like butter.
It roars with first thunder. Struck on the ground, it unleashes a wave of energy that flows forward a short distance from the wizard. It deals 2d8 ka damage and knocks back creatures.
It pulses with primal war. Raised aloft, it unleashes a ring of energy that deals 6d8 ka damage to all nearby creatures and blasts them back a ways.

properties.name: Imbued
properties.description: The wizard’s will keeps the metal magic moshing.

properties.name: Multi-weave
properties.description: Can be used multiple times on the same weapon.

metempsychosis.name: Metempsychosis
metempsychosis.description: Though individual abmortals may expect to live forever, accidents do happen. Fortunately, the finest of sanators have a solution: trans-migration of the hakaba code. The wizard breaks down a patient’s essential structure and translates it into another nearby physical form. For best results, the latest incarnation should be a replica of the original, but thrifty abmortals have made do with crude golems, animals, and even crystals or vats of memory liquid.

ranks.effect: Budget transmigration. The wizard immerses the patient in a frigid bath and spends one day translating one of their mental stats. This ritual damages the patient’s source body, making translating their remaining stats more difficult.
Full-corpus transmigration. The wizard uses a gelid sarcolector to translate all of a patient’s mental stats in one day. This destroys the original body.

Sudden action transmigration. The wizard imbues the patient with a translator parasite. It takes the parasite a day to embed, after that the wizard can translate all of patient’s stats in a few minutes. This causes the original body to spontaneously combust.

Telemetempsychosis. The wizard uses an imbued translator parasite entangled with a destination vessel. The parasite needs a day to embed, but after that, translation is nearly instan-taneous, with a range of several hundred thousand kilometres. This causes the original body to violently combust.

properties.name: Imbue ka-ba vessel
properties.description: The wizard can imbue a body with the spell to accept the patient's essential code on trigger. The transfer can be auto-mated or initiated by the patient.

properties.name: Intact bodies
properties.description: If the patient is intact and willing, the wizard does not need to test to succeed. Damaged patients make transmigrations challenging.

properties.name: Morphic shock
properties.description: Patients translated into different forms suffer psychophysical burdens.

properties.name: Overwrite
properties.description: If the destination is an unresisting conscious creature, its mental stats are overwritten by this spell. However, if it resists, a psychic conflict occurs.

properties.name: Telemagic
properties.description: Action at a distance.

properties.name: Transfer
properties.description: So-called souls between so-called vessels.

midsummerssong.name: Midsummer’s Song
midsummerssong.flavor: I am your sun, eat my flesh.
midsummerssong.description: The broccomancer gives of themselves that the ecology may flourish and grow strong.

ranks.effect: A plant sprouts, a flower blossoms, a fruit ripens.
Plants adjacent to the broccomancer are healed, or flourish.
Near the broccomancer.
In a large area.
As far as the broccomancer can see.

properties.name: Ritual of hours
properties.description: Takes as many hours (minimum 1 minute) as the spell price paid by the wizard.

properties.name: Three-step bounty
properties.description: One casting to sprout, a second to grow and blossom, a third to ripen.

nanolithharvest.name: Nanolith Harvest
nanolithharvest.description: The dialecticrat modulates their electroplasm to break down oldtech artefacts and devices.

ranks.effect: Over a few minutes, the dialecticrat harvests a nanolith pebble from an oldtech or otherwise magical artefact. Soap-sized artefacts are destroyed, larger objects decay.
Harvests two pebbles from a stone-sized or larger item. Stone-sized items are destroyed, larger objects decay.
Harvests four pebbles from a sack-sized or larger artefact. Sack-sized artefacts are destroyed, larger ones decay.
8 pebbles from a shipment-sized (1 ton) or larger artefact. Shipment-sized artefacts destroyed, larger ones decay.

properties.name: Ka attack
properties.description: [-] vs unwilling oldtech machines. If the attack fails, no nanoliths are harvested.

properties.name: Nanolith pebble
properties.description: A soap-sized aggregate of nanoliths. As an action, the dialecticrat can spend any number of pebbles. Each pebble adds 1d6 to any roll or generates 1d6 temporary life for spellcasting.

properties.name: Quick-harvest
properties.description: Double spell cost to harvest in a few seconds.

necrophony.name: Necrophony
necrophony.flavor: I am … hearing someone … a Joh … Jam … Jack! Do you know a Jack? Your dead brother? Yes, it’s your dead brother, Jack, talking to me!
necrophony.description: The dead-talker uses the shell or possession of a once-living thing—a bone, a tooth, a dead tree, or a pocket watch—to send their voice probing into the void-sea of non-existence, to tease out the remnants of consciousness. They roll their eyes, gnash their teeth, and speak in strange post-mortal tongues for a few minutes to find their ghost.

ranks.effect: Fragments and whispers come through. The conversation is poor. [-] to the ghost’s attitude.
The voice comes through, barely strong enough for a normal conversation.
Drawn to the vis viva of the wizard, the ghost is eager [+].
The power of the necrologist forces three clear answers out of the ghost, regardless of attitude.
The wizard’s voice binds the ghost to stay and answer to them until the sun rises or sets.
The wizard eats the ghost and holds it captive in their mind, able to riffle through its memories and speak with its voice until the sun rises or sets.

properties.name: Better dialogues
properties.description: This spell is the standard way a necromancer improves their conversation with the dead (see Dialogues table).

nomenestomen.name: Nomen Est Omen
nomenestomen.description: The navi describes and names a target, thus gaining the ability to manipulate it through its nomen.

ranks.effect: Traces. The world whispers to the wizard, “Here, your named target passed here, it went there.”
Vulnerable. The target’s body gasps, “This is an old injury, here the armour is broken.” Wizard gains [+] to one roll against the target per round.
Predict. The target’s mind guesses, “If I do this, I shall be well.” Wizard acts before the target each round and gains [+] to tests vs the target.

Guide. The wizard speaks to the target with voices of  world, body and mind, “Here, go here; do this; try that.” The target is sure it follows its own free will. The wizard spends an action to give each new command.

properties.name: Cumulative
properties.description: Each power includes its lower-order effects.

properties.name: Focus
properties.description: To hear the cosmos. Double spell price: free focus.

properties.name: Nomen
properties.description: Creates a 1 st nomen anchor per researched target.

properties.name: Research
properties.description: Requires a day’s physical and metaphysical study.

properties.name: Universalize
properties.description: The wizard can imbue a nomen with 7 life to expand it from a specific target to a general type, for example, from “Horace the Gate Dragon” to “all Horaces.” The wizard can reduce the imbue cost by 1 for each concept used to specify the target type more precisely. Example: “all blue-haired green-eyed Horaces” costs 5 life, while “all flying red dragons with no eyes” costs 4.

noösphereintegration.name: Noösphere Integration
noösphereintegration.flavor: Be now consumed by the all.
noösphereintegration.description: The wizard submerges their false self and becomes one with the living world around them.

ranks.effect: Interface. The wizard feels the pulse and breath and thought of life in a small area. [+] to detect hidden creatures and vs surprise.
Breakdown. The wizard gets a summary of current and recent biological processes in the area. Eating, excreting, living, dying. Can track without failure.
Agent. The wizard is embraced by the noösphere. They choose whether natural creatures notice their presence. If they choose to be noticed, they gain [+] to social tests.

Meld. The noösphere consumes the wizard. Their body is eaten by the living creatures of the area and their mind and personality (ka and ba) travels unseen in the movement of birds and beetles, the sigh of grass and the creak of trees. When the spell ends, their body is reconstituted from dead organic matter over about a day.
Avatar. The wizard releases all the anchors of their self. In so doing, they become the dragon.

properties.name: Dangerous
properties.description: Giving up the self is always a hazardous game.

properties.name: Expand
properties.description: Double spell price to encompass a large area.

properties.name: Imbue
properties.description: Integration lasts as long as the wizard imbues the spell.

properties.name: Dissolution
properties.description: Each time the wizard casts Noösphere integration they must pay part of the spell price with at least one point of thought or charisma as a part of them dissolves. If their thought and charisma are both 0, the spell price is reduced by 1.

nothingremains.name: Nothing Remains
nothingremains.flavor: If you die before you wake.
nothingremains.description: With a gesture, the voidwalker accelerates entropy.

ranks.effect: Fires to ash, batteries go flat.
Joints ache, vehicles slow down, iron rusts.
Houses crumble to rubble, lives burn out, diamonds dull and cease to shine.
Kingdoms end, sky castles fall, domesticated suns die out.

properties.name: Null
properties.description: Not magical.

nunkascombatadaptation.name: Nunka’s Combat Adaptation
nunkascombatadaptation.description: The caster grows claws, horns, venom glands, clubs, spines, or fangs on creatures. The adaptation occupies an inventory slot.

ranks.effect: Over a day, the caster coaxes natural weaponry to develop. A rabbit gains dagger-like biting teeth (1d4 ha), while an elephant grows a muscular tail with a thagomizer (1d12 ha). A creature with existing attacks increases their damage die one step.
Dice increase one more step.
One more step.
One more.

properties.name: Affliction
properties.description: Obviously.

properties.name: Rupture
properties.description: The weaponry bursts out in seconds, dealing 1d6* damage. Spell price doubles.

properties.name: Willing flesh
properties.description: First time, free.

obeliskinterface.name: Obelisk Interface
obeliskinterface.description: The nürdü skollét touches an oldtech ruin or artefact and falls into a trance for a few minutes as their electroplasm interfaces with the radiation echo of the ancient construct.
