ranks.effect: Vibes. The nürdü’s mind picks up who the device’s creators were and what its intended purpose was. They also learn if there is residual juice and what kind of magitech it actuates.
Read. The nürdü accesses the oldtech’s integrated user manual. They find nearby hidden doors and gain [+] to bypassing security protocols.
Map. The nürdü downloads a schematic of the original construct. At the very least, this gives [+] to navigating or using it.

Analyse. The nürdü’s electroplasm generates a repair protocol for fixing the oldtech construct. In play, this might involve 1d4+1 missing or broken parts and tests to replace them. Each test is [d6]: (1–3) very hard, (4–5) hard, (6) moderate.

Reverse engineer. The nürdü generates an electroplasmic false-sentient package (1 stone) of instructions for building a copy of an oldtech artefact. The building will involve 1d4+1 expensive tests ([d6]: (1–3) extreme, (4–5) very hard, (6) hard).

properties.name: Obelisk
properties.description: As a nürdü uses this spell, a dark monolith echoes in their mind. Promising, whispering.

properties.name: Sequential
properties.description: The nürdü must cast each power level in sequence on an individual construct. For example, they cannot analyse an electric catacomb without having mapped it first.

onlyafoolhasaface.name: Only A Fool Has A Face
onlyafoolhasaface.description: The wizard takes their face … off. Beneath it is a different face. Is it faces all the way down?

ranks.effect: While the wizard focusses, their identity is bland and unmemorable. [+] to subterfuge.
Their identity is absent, their face blank, their voice a buzzing polyphony.
Passing their hand over another face, then over their own, the wizard overwrites their identity with another person’s.
Peeling off their face, the wizard reveals a believable synthetic identity generated by underlying reality algorithms.
The wizard reveals a true face. Their honesty blazes forth, cowing the world with its truth. Lower level creatures cannot lie to the wizard. The wizard gains [+] to social tests.

properties.name: Focus
properties.description: Requires concentration.

properties.name: Costly imbue
properties.description: Double spell cost to avoid having to focus.

openthedoorofworms.name: Open the Door of Worms
openthedoorofworms.description: The wizard traces an outline on a surface. It shimmers and then erupts into a sucking doorway.

ranks.effect: Door leads through a wall.
It leads through empty air from the wizard’s hand to as far as they could shoot an arrow.
It leads through sheer wormspace to a point the wizard has visited before. Travel through wormspace always takes a week.
It opens directly into wormspace, letting the wizard exit anywhere in the Given World. Travel to places the wizard has not visited takes 1d4* weeks. Beware of grey paradox worms.

properties.name: Imbue
properties.description: Life force to keep doors open, portals un-shuttered.

properties.name: Revelation
properties.description: Cannot be learned.

parasomatransference.name: Parasoma Transference
parasomatransference.description: What is life but the purposeful reordering of the underlying energy patterns of the Given World? The skilled wizard can transfer life from one creature to another using the principles of universal existential identity. The descended folk call this a life shunt.

ranks.effect: Basic shunt. For each point transferred, recipient gains 1 life.
Enriched shunt. For each point, recipient gains 1d2 life.
Power shunt. Recipient gains 1d3 life per point.
Gains 1d4 life per point.
Gains 1d6 life per point.

properties.name: Telemagic
properties.description: Cheaper, innit?

properties.name: Transfer
properties.description: The name of the game.

permissionrescission.name: Permission Rescission
permissionrescission.flavor: Pay the piper, cast it out.
permissionrescission.description: The wizard cloaks themselves in the blue and green pigments that daemons fear and daubs their fingers with catfish fat. Then they wave four magic incense sticks, one for earth, one for sky, one for wind, one for green, as they revoke a daemon’s permission to remain in a target creature, object, or form.

ranks.effect: The chants command the attention of a mild poison or disease daemon, something that causes afflictions like nausea, vertigo, diarrhoea, the common cold or dandruff.
A playful, confused, or accidental daemon is drawn into dialogue. Perhaps cowardice, error, sloth, or indecision.
A moderate poison or disease daemon deigns to talk with the wizard, something that may be debilitating but not deadly, for example, the flu or alcohol poisoning.
A persistent or curse-bound possession talks. Perhaps melancholy or ennui.
A deadly poison or disease daemon, or a curse bearer, listens to the wizard. The plague, syphilis, or mercury poisoning.
A malevolent or hostile possession begins a dialogue. Perhaps madness, lycanthropy, or bureaucracy.
A terminal affliction daemon stops to talk with the wizard. Perhaps a radiation daemon or a metastatic tumour.

properties.name: Banish the weak
properties.description: If the spell cost is thrice the level of the daemon (twice if the wizard knows its true name), it is bani­shed outright, without any dialogue. The wizard may over­pay the spell cost to banish a daemon.

properties.name: Bribe
properties.description: By offering a suitable libation, the wizard gains [+] to their dialogue test.

properties.name: Dialogue
properties.description: Must talk the daemon into accepting the rescission.

properties.name: Healing
properties.description: Convincing a daemon to leave may remove a burden from a character, but it never restores lost attributes. Time and rest must repair those.

properties.name: Redirect
properties.description: A malicious wizard may convince an afflicting daemon to attempt to possess somebody else, rather than going straight home to the aether.

poisonedwhispers.name: Poisoned Whispers
poisonedwhispers.flavor: See how the truth breaks even you?
poisonedwhispers.description: The selective revelation of the uroboros drives the un-initiated slightly mad in predictable ways.

ranks.effect: Adjacent target tests endu­rance or aura. Fail: gains a free action to do what caster wants.
A hard test.
An extreme test.
There is no test. There is but to do what the atlik commands.
Target gains [+] to their free action.
Target gets a free action every round until the end of the scene. Each time, they do the wizard’s bidding.
And when first they hear the whisper, they get two free actions.

prismaticmanipulation.name: Prismatic Manipulation
prismaticmanipulation.description: The photic manipulates ambient light in a dazzling dance of sensory incoherence. Each effect influences an area or objects the wizard could encompass with arms outstretched.

ranks.effect: Mirror. The target area behaves like a perfect mirror. Immune to light effects, [+] vs energy effects.
Refract. The target looks different: like another nearby object or creature, or even entirely invisible. [+] to stealth, disguise, and vs direct attacks.
Bend. Light bends completely around the target, rendering it fully concealed by a luminous event horizon. Unless there is a light source inside the area, it is entirely dark.

properties.name: Focus
properties.description: Photic moves the affected area or modifies a higher power effect to one of lower power.

properties.name: Imbue
properties.description: Effect persists.

properties.name: Project
properties.description: Double spell price to encompass adjacent area. Double again to encompass nearby area.

realitydecryption.name: Reality Decryption
realitydecryption.flavor: Reading the ten keys of all matter.
realitydecryption.description: The nucleotheologist uses the existential translations and the substance of perfect being to read a physical object’s structure.

ranks.effect: A few minutes give a simple readout of the energies (evil, magic, antimagic, radiation, good vibrations) given off by an object.
A few minutes reveals the physical composition of an object.
The wizard also discerns recent magical and mundane modifications of the object.
They can discern information by merely waving their hands around an object without physical contact.
The wizard also discerns the deep physical structure of an object, its flaws and strengths.
Discern information at a distance, using a telescope or vidy link.

properties.name: Faster reading
properties.description: Getting a ten times faster reading doubles the spell price.

properties.name: Opus box
properties.description: Using a box halves spell prices (minimum 1).

properties.name: Slower at scale
properties.description: Durations are for a soap-sized object. Scanning a stone-sized objects takes a quarter of an hour, a sack takes an hour, a shipment a few hours, etc.

realtimerebuild.name: Real-time Rebuild
realtimerebuild.description: The zdarovar plunges their spiritual hand into the target. They then summon undamaged hakaba codes from the oneiroi Quiscus and Sanatus to directly overwrite the target’s current iteration. This painful process lasts a few minutes.

ranks.effect: A cosmetic blemish or a bad fright is wiped away.
A toxin or affliction is flushed from the system.
A damaged organ is restored to factory settings.
A whole limb is regrown.
A head or torso regrows.
From dust and fragments, a whole body is rebuilt.

properties.name: Consciousness
properties.description: Only affects conscious targets.

properties.name: Painful
properties.description: Deals damage equal to spell price. This damage cannot kill the victim (but may traumatise).

properties.name: Swifter
properties.description: The process lasts a few seconds but is twice as painful.

rehoryansmendingflesh.name: Rehoryan’s Mending Flesh
rehoryansmendingflesh.description: The biomancer touches an organism and focuses. Its flesh and bone start to repair.

ranks.effect: Organism regenerates 1 life  per round. After an hour, one burden, such as a broken bone or injured pride, is reduced—e.g., the broken bone sets but stays fragile.
2 life per round. Burden reduced after half an hour. One lost extremity regrows after an hour.
3 life per round. Burden reduced after a quarter-hour. One lost organ regrows after an hour.

properties.name: Exhausting
properties.description: The biomancer can only sustain the mending for 10 minutes per level. Then they need a bit of air, maybe a cigarette, and a fresh casting of the spell.

properties.name: Focus
properties.description: to keep healing.

replicationofempire.name: Replication of Empire
replicationofempire.description: The aquarik draws strands of reality out of thin air and plucks them like a lyre, actualizing the secret omens and the absolute nomos of reality to replicate the creations ruled by the sublunar. This takes a few minutes.

ranks.effect: The aquarik duplicates a bucketful of air or other aether.
They duplicate a jug of water or other liquid ruled by the blue.
Duplicates a box of wood, earth, or other stuff of the green.
Duplicates a pig of iron, steel, stone, or other item monochrome.
Replicates a pot’s worth of matter held in the aquarik’s mind.
Duplicates a complex 1 stone arrangement of matter. For example a person’s head.

properties.name: Hodl
properties.description: The aquarik spends a day meditating upon a material object. They fix this item in their mind as an anchor (1 stone) and can replicate it without reference to the original.

properties.name: Instant
properties.description: The aquarik pays double the spell price to instantly materialize the matter.

properties.name: Moar
properties.description: Duplicate 10x the matter, double the spell price.

properties.name: Warning
properties.description: Uncontrolled replication of specie or currency may crash an economy.

reweavereality.name: Reweave Reality
reweavereality.description: Over a few hours the manalik uses focussing lenses and buffing leathers to polish the energy of the sun itself into a stuckforce solid attuned to their own soul.

ranks.effect: The solid is no more than an inch across and can carry 1 soap.
Measures no more than a span across and carries 1 stone.
A cubit across and carries 1 sack.
An ulna across and carries 3 sacks.
A fathom across. Carries 6 sacks.
4 metres. Carries 1 shipment.

properties.name: Tether
properties.description: A manalik can use a rope harness woven from their own hair (or some more ordinary rope) to pull their stuckforce solid along, like a floating pack mule.

properties.name: Imbue
properties.description: The manalik’s life keeps the force sticking around. Unimbued, it dissipates in a week or two.

properties.name: Postphysical
properties.description: The inertialess disc stays at complete rest in relation to  local gravity sources unless moved by the wizard’s touch. Absorbed energy flares off as light and heat.

properties.name: Shapes
properties.description: Simple solids, such as orbs, discs, sheets, and cylinders require no test. More complex shapes call for a relevant skill test, e.g., sculpture, pottery, or weaving.

properties.name: Shield
properties.description: The stuckforce is almost completely impenetrable, and shields against ranged attacks.

sacredreliquary.name: Sacred Reliquary
sacredreliquary.description: The wizard spends an hour or two binding a ghost’s non-corporeal ba and ka through a relic housed in a reliquary. This can be as simple as a prepared skull or something as ornate as a gilded model of an office ziggurat with window panels of mother-of-pearl and translucent jade holding a lock of a sage’s beard.

ranks.effect: A very basic reliquary, barely magical. The necromantic equivalent of writing down somebody’s phone number. When using Necrophony to reach this ghost, the wizard gains [+].
Direct line reliquary. The ghost is grumpy, but answers every time the dead-talker calls.
An open line reliquary. The ghost can come through and manifest as an ectoplasmic projection on their own, without the caster’s input. Non-wizards can communicate with the spirit.
A command line reliquary. The ghost can possess a mechanical or biological body through the reliquary and act directly in the living world.

properties.name: Imbued relic
properties.description: The reliquary is infused with vitality. The caster can use their life or a willing acolyte's.

properties.name: Sustenance lock
properties.description: When using an external life source, a devious necromancer can make the bond permanent by binding one of their own life points to the reliquary. This sustains the ghost until the reliquary is destroyed.

sevenvenomsong.name: Seven Venom Song
sevenvenomsong.flavor: Threads bind us all in memory.
sevenvenomsong.description: The flying serpent revealed seven venoms to the cachars. They preserve them in their chants.

ranks.effect: Pain. An angry red liquid. Target deals & suffers +2 damage until the end of the scene.
Weakness. Cool and black. Target suffers [-] to ha tests and effects until the end of the scene.
Blindness. Sparkling blue fluid. Target suffers [-] to ha, ka, or ba tests until scene ends.
Eating. Sickly green. Target loses 5 life per action it takes until the scene ends.
Petrifying. Shimmering dusty beverage. Target turns to stone while the potion is imbued.
Medusa. Piercing white. Target is petrified with self-doubt as it grasps the infinite recursion of its existence within the world. Loses 1d4 mental attributes per action it takes until scene ends.

Manticore. Pure pink light. Target makes an endurance test every time it takes an action until scene ends. When it fails, its mind and spirit are knocked out of its body, which falls to the ground lifeless. Psychosurgery is required to reattach its ghost.

properties.name: Imbue
properties.description: See below.

properties.name: Potion
properties.description: Vials sold separately.

signalcharge.name: Signal Charge
signalcharge.description: The wizard rubs their hands together without rhythm and builds up an electromagical charge. Their hands stay charged until they discharge the energy or touch a conducting object.

ranks.effect: Wizard’s next touch deals 1d10 electric damage.
Touch also stuns the target for 1d4 rounds or knocks it back.
Touch also sets the target on fire, dealing 1d6 ha/round until put out (stop, drop, and roll).
Deals 4d10 damage instead.
Touch also commands an electrical to move nearby or gives 2 immediate actions.

properties.name: Imbue
properties.description: Charged until release.

properties.name: Recharge
properties.description: This spell recharges batteries and magic power cells if the wizard succeeds at an aura test to modulate the signal field. One charge per spell cost.

singingintheblood.name: Singing in the Blood
singingintheblood.flavor: The ocean, it lives in the blood.
singingintheblood.description: By exchanging blood or other fluids between two creatures, the wizard lets them communicate directly through their shared evolutionary bond and the magic of the noösphere.

ranks.effect: Two creatures of the same species can communicate mind-to-mind over a long distance.
Two related species, for example two birds or two reptiles.
Very distantly related species, e.g. a fish and an ape.
Species evolved on the same world, e.g. a medusa and a wolf.
Aliens who have shared the salt and dust of the same noösphere for a day and a night.

properties.name: Imbue
properties.description: The life energy of one of the creatures binds the spell into place. If this creature is the wizard, they do not pay the spell cost twice. It ends when that creature releases the energy.

properties.name: Ha attack
properties.description: Jabbing an unwilling creature with a needle is not easy.

properties.name: Needles
properties.description: Sterile equipment is recommended for this spell.

properties.name: Understanding
properties.description: Double spell price: communication is deep and meaningful. [+] to conversations.

skilltegrate.name: Skilltegrate
skilltegrate.description: Electroplasm invades a machine and learns how to use it, translating that knowledge directly into a host neural network.

ranks.effect: The wizard figures out what skills are needed to use a device.
The electroplasm temporarily inscribes a relevant rank 1 skill into an available skill slot.
Inscribes a relevant rank 2 skill into two available skill slots.
Inscribes a relevant rank 3 skill into 3 available skill slots.
Inscribes a relevant rank 4 skill into 4 available skill slots. Danger. Error. Overload.

properties.name: Imbue
properties.description: The skill remains as long as the spell is imbued.

properties.name: Otherwrite
properties.description: Double spell cost to overwrite an existing skill or inscribe the skill into an inventory or trait slot.

properties.name: Permanence
properties.description: Triple spell cost and dangerous. But, permanent.

skinshift.name: Skinshift
skinshift.flavor: Walk a mile in its fur.
skinshift.description: The wizard dons the skin and form of another creature. The transformation takes several minutes. The target creature’s attributes replace the wizard’s own. If the target creature cannot speak, neither can the wizard.

ranks.effect: Mass conservative. Wizard takes the form of a creature roughly their size. For a human, this might be a dog, pig, donkey, ostrich, or another human.
Mass flexible. Shrinks to the size of a tiny creature, such as a gerbil, pigeon, or frog, or grows into a larger creature, such as a tuna, aurochs, or bear.
Mass ignorant. From a tiny mosquito or ladybird, to a ponderous pachyderm or whale.
Distributed. Shifts into a colony organism, such as a swarm of termites, hive of mole rats, or herd of telepathic feral hogs.

properties.name: Alien kingdom
properties.description: Shifting into an alien creature, such as a fungus, carnivorous plant, or zu-construct, doubles the spell price.

properties.name: Imbue
properties.description: Obviously.

properties.name: Sketch
properties.description: The wizard can spend an hour sketching a creature and taking down its noöspheric source code parameters, letting them don the skin symbolically, without actual skinning.

properties.name: Skins
properties.description: If the wizard is carrying a target creature’s prepared skin (1 stone), the transformation takes but a heartbeat.

properties.name: Slain
properties.description: If the skin-shifted wizard is slain, they revert to their original form. If they were using a prepared skin, the wizard’s original form is uninjured but dazed for a few minutes (loses 1 action per turn). The skin is destroyed.

properties.name: Symbolic
properties.description: Spell price doubled if wizard uses a symbolic representation of the creature, rather than actual skin. A popular option, as a single illustrated journal can hold hundreds of skins.

somnihilation.name: Somnihilation
somnihilation.description: The wizard releases their holy blood and uses it to anoint an undead abomination, such as a mummy, skeleton, vampire, or zombie. This takes a couple of minutes and a lot of passionate imprecation. The undead abomination then returns to its appointed rest. An assistant usually holds down the abomination during the ritual.

ranks.effect: Puts down a 1st level abomination.
A 2nd level abomination.
L3 abomination. Etc.

properties.name: Five symbol death punch
properties.description: By doubling the spell price, the wizard requires a single action to imbue their fist with the five symbols of eternal repose. Their next successful ha or ka attack against an undead abomination puts it to rest.

properties.name: Sudden conduit
properties.description: At the moment of contact with the abomination, the wizard comprehends its actual power level. They can then open the gates of their soul, pouring more life into the spell to defeat the undead if it is more powerful than they expected. Unfortunately, this may make the magic dangerous.

soulscourge.name: Soul Scourge
soulscourge.description: The wizard puts their hands to their forehead in the null-dimensional key and unleashes an indiscriminate, nightmarish attack on every affected soul. The wizard deals 1d6 x level ka damage to each target in the area.

ranks.effect: Attacks a single target next to the wizard.
3 targets next to the wizard.
Up to 10 nearby targets.
Up to 25 far away targets.
Up to 66 far away targets.
All targets in a v. large cone.
All targets in a cone as far as the wizard can see.

properties.name: Cone
properties.description: The spell scourges a conical area ahead of the wizard.

properties.name: Ka attack
properties.description: Vs all, willing and unwilling alike.

properties.name: Mind-burned
properties.description: If a target is reduced to 0 life and the wizard has an action remaining on their turn, they can turn it into a ka-zombie. Their mind burns out the target’s personality and takes control. The ka-zombie regains all missing life, but is now under the wizard’s mental control. Giving instructions requires an action, but the ka-zombie will continue to perform a task (e.g., “attack the lizard human”) without supervision.

properties.name: Overburn
properties.description: Wizard can spend 1 mental stat to add 1d6 to their ka attack natural roll.

snakeform.name: Snakeform
snakeform.description: The zyxommanto eats themselves in a single gulp and emerges from a point of shadow as a serpent.

ranks.effect: The caster becomes a snake. Mass is conserved, so they are quite large. They can cast spells as a snake, but have no hands. Gain a constricting ha attack (1d6): deals automatic damage with each action after it hits.
Armoured. [+] vs ha dmg.
Venomous. Its bite (1d8 ha) can inject any potion the wizard has prepared.
Larger. Mass is not conserved. Damage dice increase 1 step.
Self-sacrificing speed. Can spend 1 attribute point per round to gain an extra action.
Larger. Damage dice increase 1 more step.
Flying. It’s a flying snake.

properties.name: Dangerous
properties.description: Well, yes.

properties.name: Imbue
properties.description: To stay a snake.

properties.name: Stuck
properties.description: The caster must succeed at a thought test to return to human form. Fail: they must pay the spell price again. The price increases by 1 life for every day they spend in snake form.

stucklight.name: Stucklight
stucklight.description: The depictomancer ‘paints’ a line or plane of light with their hands and then solidifies it. The larger the effect, the longer it takes. Using a mould or canvas to capture the light is faster, but the initial setup takes longer.

ranks.effect: The light feels as dense and strong as foam. Several planes of light can safely block a fall.
The light feels like bread. Several planes safely stop a galloping rhino.
It feels like ice. Running into a plane of this light hurts.
Like granite. Lines of this make a formidable barricade.
Like steel. Planes and lines of this light cut like blades.
Feels denser and stronger than ordinary matter. This light cuts steel like butter.
Dense and strong enough for a single filament of light to shear through steel and bone and rushing vehicles.

properties.name: Default
properties.description: Neutral grey.

properties.name: Imbue
properties.description: Stays solid while the wizard’s life is locked within.

symphonyofshapes.name: Symphony of Shapes
symphonyofshapes.description: The wizard imposes an anti-entropic architectural geometry upon the world around them, singing mindless matter into the forms most pleasing to the GBD.

ranks.effect: A point of reality coalesces into a stone-like substance. It slowly accretes to the size of a sphere the wizard can hold in their hand.
The wizard pulls a line of solid matter, no thicker than their wrist, into existence.
Spreading hands with deluvian motions, creates a plane of matter no thicker than their palm.
Tracing form into fact, a geometric solid settles into existence.
The wizard seems to deform, revealing the higher dimensional nature of every thinking being, as their many flagella bring a four-dimensional object into being.

properties.name: Dimensions
properties.description: The wizard creates as much matter each minute as they encompass with their outstretched hands.

properties.name: Focus
properties.description: With concentration, massive objects are possible.

tabularasa.name: Tabula Rasa
tabularasa.flavor: A soulless body is a happy vessel.
tabularasa.description: The wizard touches two soul anchors (creatures, vessels, etc.) and swaps their soul-personalities.

ranks.effect: Transfers the ka-ba of up to 2 levels’ worth of creatures (for example, between two first level creatures).
Up to 4 levels’ worth of creatures.
6 levels’ worth.
Etc.

properties.name: Battering
properties.description: Double spell cost to gain [+] on ka attack.

properties.name: Ka attack
properties.description: Vs unwilling.

properties.name: Lightning machine
properties.description: Using a special laboratory and ectoplasmic storm halves the spell cost.

properties.name: Mind swap
properties.description: The two creatures swap mental stats, memories, skills, and traits.

properties.name: Static vessel
properties.description: Transferring a soul-personality into or from a jar, pot, crystal matrix, or other static object doubles the spell cost.

thewillingvoidnihilvolunt.name: The Willing Void — Nihil Volunt
thewillingvoidnihilvolunt.flavor: We made the singularity of not.
thewillingvoidnihilvolunt.description: The voidwalker draws a circle of circles upon the air, encompassing a sacred void. As their life flows into this void, so it attracts other objects into itself.

ranks.effect: The void pulls in nearby light objects. Pages, leaves, hats. Everything is slightly crumpled in the middle of the void.
Nearby cat-sized objects are drawn in swiftly, sustaining painful but harmless bruising as they are jammed together.
Nearby pig-sized objects are sucked in, thumping together with significant force in the middle of the void (1d6 damage). Crushing may suffocate unfortunates.
Horse-sized objects from quite a ways around are hauled into the centre at speed (2d6 damage), then mashed together, injuring them (1d4 per round)
Elephant-sized objects in a large area are swiftly pulled into the void, smashing together violently (4d6 damage) and congealing under the void pressures (2d4 per round).
Tree-sized objects in a large radius are sucked into the void, taking 8d6 damage and then igniting under the unearthly pressures (4d4 per round).

properties.name: Imbued void
properties.description: The hole in reality persists as long as the wizard imbues it with their life essence.

theworm.name: The Worm
theworm.description: The guivriste parts the veils of reality, and the great worm uncoils from the ground or from the shadows or even from the clear blue sky. Terror ensues.

ranks.effect: The worm manifest appears.
Two worms appear.
Three worms.
Four worms.
Worms swallow the caster and all adjacent creatures.

properties.name: Dangerous
properties.description: Obviously.

properties.name: Imbue
properties.description: The caster’s life keeps the worm present.

properties.name: Slow
properties.description: Requires 2 actions to cast.

tormentengine.name: Torment Engine
tormentengine.flavor: Work the soul, burn the candle.
tormentengine.description: The wizard’s glittering touch traps a creature’s soul in an infinite loop and mills it for energy.

ranks.effect: Victim loses 1 life and 1 personal memory per round. Wizard gains enough energy to recharge an omni-battery.
Victim loses 1 stat point and 1 skill per round. Enough energy to recharge a radiothermal barrel.
Victim loses 1 level and 1 trait per round. Enough energy to recharge an oldtech town generator.

properties.name: Escape the labyrinth
properties.description: Each round, the victim makes a thought test to escape the torment engine. Thereafter, it gains [+] vs the wizard’s magic.

properties.name: Ka attack
properties.description: Vs unwilling.

properties.name: Dangerous
properties.description: For the target.

properties.name: Destruction
properties.description: This spell perma­nently damages or destroys souls.

properties.name: Overburn
properties.description: Wizard can spend 1 mental stat to add 1d6 to their ka attack natural roll.

properties.name: Siphon
properties.description: Focus to sustain the drain.

properties.name: Soul-thrower
properties.description: With their other hand, the wizard can channel the creature’s shattered soul like a celestial flamethrower. This deals 1d10 damage per power of the spell (so a P6 torment engine will deal 6d10 damage) to all targets in a narrow, short-range jet of blistering hell-fire.

properties.name: Unsafeguard
properties.description: Wizard can double the burn rate (and power) of the torment engine by doubling its cost. This is dangerous all-round.

twitchingpuppet.name: Twitching Puppet
twitchingpuppet.description: The wizard raises their hands, and a crackling gush of electro-magical bolts unerringly strikes a nearby target for 1d6 ha damage.

ranks.effect: The target loses 1 life per round. Each round, the wizard may make a ka attack against the target on the target's turn. If they succeed, they gain poor control of the target’s physical movements for that round—it makes all rolls with [-]. Controlling the target requires no actions.
Target loses 2 life per round. If the wizard has control of the target, their control is satisfactory, and it rolls normally.
Target loses 3 life per round. The wizard's control is ka-infused, and target rolls with [+].

properties.name: Focus
properties.description: To maintain the link.

properties.name: Oh-mega
properties.description: Requires the rods for fine motor control.

properties.name: Open channel
properties.description: The spell continues until the target touches the wizard, it dies, or the wizard stops focusing.

ubiqueserpens.name: Ubique Serpens
ubiqueserpens.description: Since all reality is, somehow, a snake-like circle, many things might become a snake. Particularly long, thing things.

ranks.effect: A big stick or garden hose becomes a snake (L1). A small, thin bundle becomes a tangle of small snakes (L0).
Bigger snake (L2) or 1d4+pro snakes (L1).
Bigger (L3) or 1d8+pro.
Yet bigger (L4) or 1d12+pro.

properties.name: Control
properties.description: The smokyar com­mands pro+thought levels of snakes. The rest are free-willed.

properties.name: Imbue
properties.description: The smokyar’s life is in their snakes. Without it, they revert to base matter.

unitywithancestors.name: Unity With Ancestors
unitywithancestors.description: The wizard takes the powdered essence of an undead creature, mixes it with sacred liquids, and turns it into ancestor juice through an hour-long ritual. Robes, candles, and cryptic chants are optional, but a vial of some sort is essential. The effects of each type of ancestor juice last about a day.

ranks.effect: Crushed skeleton bones. The drinker loses 1d3 endurance and becomes resistant to soft tissue damage and poisons.
Dried and powdered zombie brain. The drinker loses 1d3 agility, gains 10 temporary life (or unlife), and becomes resistant to non-critical ha attacks.

Diced and sliced ghoul. The drinker loses 1d3 aura but gains a paralyzing touch. Each time a creature is touched by the drinker, they lose 1 action. Further, and more horrifically, the drinker can regain 1d4 life each hour by eating a quarter-pounder of living flesh (cheese optional). This secondary effect is not widely advertised.
Ash of a shadow, phantasm, or ghost. The drinker loses 1d3 str, deals ha damage with [-], and takes minimum damage from all physical sources.
Shredded mummy flakes. The drinker loses 1d4 cha, then gains a rotting touch. Every time they deal ha damage, they also deal 1 charisma damage.
Preserved vampire blood. The drinker loses 1d4 thought, then grows claws and fangs. Deals 1d8+level ha damage and regains life equal to damage dealt when fighting living creatures.

properties.name: Dangerous beverage
properties.description: The (un)holy ancestor juice can corrupt those who drink it.

properties.name: Imbued beverage
properties.description: The juice keeps as long as the wizard imbues it with their life.

properties.name: Pass for (un)dead
properties.description: All the juices make the drinker appear undead at first glance.

properties.name: Proscribed
properties.description: This spell is proscribed by all reasonable scholars and commissars. Practising it in public often results in censure and persecution.

ushaswildmutation.name: Usha’s Wild Mutation
ushaswildmutation.description: The caster speaks to a creature’s source code, sparking mutation.

ranks.effect: The mutation takes 1d4 rounds to complete and deals 1d6* damage per round. A random mutation fills a trait slot.
Caster chooses the mutation.
… and modifies the mutation.

properties.name: Horror
properties.description: Super freaky.

properties.name: Willing flesh
properties.description: Acquiesce!

valueaddeduplift.name: Value Added Uplift
valueaddeduplift.flavor: We went among the ants as gods.
valueaddeduplift.description: The caster increases the intelligence of a non-sentient creature or colony organism. Now anyone can play god! Very dangerous.

ranks.effect: Over a few days the biomancer increases the thought attribute of a creature and its keimplasma, its germplasm, by 1.
Increase thought by 1 more!
Again!
Again!
Again! “Behold, I am Pro-metheus, and I have given you the world!” cries the sci-wizard at the sentient slime mould.

properties.name: Affliction
properties.description: Hurts the subject.

properties.name: Ladder of reason
properties.description: Each subsequent casting on an individual organism is at a higher power, thus progressively harder.

properties.name: Love the creator
properties.description: There is a chance the creature will be pleased with its new situation.

properties.name: Very dangerous
properties.description: [-] to corruption tests when things go wrong.

properties.name: Willing flesh
properties.description: Creatures usually like to be who they are.

vividcommunion.name: Vivid Communion
vividcommunion.description: The drevedroog plunges their mind into the ur-consciousness of the local ecosystem, communing with mushroom and thorn shrub and mighty baobab.

ranks.effect: Plants whisper and tell if they have been trod or touched.
A chorus of plants within arms’ reach awakens with a simple intelligence and tells all.

All nearby plants assemble into an average intelligence and let the derevedroog know what has happened and is happening. The drevedroog cannot be surprised and gains [+] to all perception tests within the area.
Plants in a large area become part of a superior communal intelligence. Drevedroog gains [+] to complex, analytic tests. Setting ambushes and traps is easy [+].

Plants as far as the drevedroog can see combine their communication organelles into a surpassing vegetable intelligence. Drevedroog can supplicate it for guidance and secrets beyond the ken of individual lifeforms.

properties.name: Cumulative
properties.description: Powers include all lower order effects.

properties.name: Focus
properties.description: So it goes.

properties.name: Permanence
properties.description: This would take some sort of sacrifice, yeah?

voidblade.name: Voidblade
voidblade.description: The mage turns nothingness into a weapon, holding it together with filaments of their own life.

ranks.effect: It deals 1d6 damage and leaves shadow scars.
It deals 1d10 damage and leaves burning wounds.
1d12 damage and steals ba, drinking 1 mental stat point per strike.
2d8 damage and steals 2 mental stat points per strike.

properties.name: Ba-zombies
properties.description: A sentient who loses their last mental stat point becomes a zombie under the wizard’s thrall. This may be evil.

properties.name: Imbued weapon
properties.description: Usually, the voidblade dissipates when the wizard stops imbuing it with their essence. Fed too many thoughts, it may refuse to be dispelled.

properties.name: Sentient voidblade
properties.description: The blade accumulates removed mental points as ba. The more ba it gains, the more sentient it becomes: 5 ba • As bright as a cat. 10 ba • Smart as a troglodyte. 15 ba • Refuses to be dispelled. Spell becomes an item. 20 ba • Thoughtful as a demon. 30 ba • Deals 1d16 damage. 40 ba • Demands regular sacrifice. 60 ba • It reveals how to Open the Door of Worms.

walkontwigs.name: Walk on Twigs
walkontwigs.description: The vochencha synchronizes a target with the vegetable world, making it one with its songs.

ranks.effect: Walking on living vegetation, the target gains [+] to stealth and balance tests.
Nature consumes all traces of passage: visible, odour, even aura. Target’s weight is halved as far as plants is concerned.
Target weighs one tenth, easily standing on thin branches.
One hundredth. As far as a reed knows, an ordinary human weighs as much as a bar of soap.
One thousandth. Imagine how far a bent bough could launch such a person! Though the landing might hurt.

properties.name: Focus
properties.description: Spell cost doubles (minimum 1) to cast unfocussed.

properties.name: Plant perception
properties.description: The spell alters how vegetation perceives the target. Because a plant has no mind to interfere with its beliefs, altered perception completely suspends its disbelief. Thus, a leaf could hold up an elephant, were a vochencha skilled enough.

walkwithme.name: Walk With Me
walkwithme.description: The wizard exhales their life force into a mummified, pickled, or other-wise preserved corpse, imbuing it with a semblance of vitality.

ranks.effect: After a few hours, the corpse awakens into a shambling parody of life and follows the hero’s instructions as a slow corpse (L1, gormless, mindless, zombie).
After a few minutes, the hero shakes the corpse into jerky life as a lurcher (L1, leaping, mindless, zombie).
After mere seconds, the hero exhorts the mummy to unlife. The mummified servant (L2, elegant, limber, zombie) grows supple and strong again.
In a flash of soul fire, the hero transforms the corpse into a ravenous swift ghoul (L3, swift, terrifying, zombie). It springs up faster and stronger than in life.

properties.name: Echo of memories
properties.description: If the wizard pays double the spell price, an echo of the corpse’s ba is restored, imbuing it with a semblance of human intelligence. The undead can then act independently.

properties.name: Imbued undead
properties.description: The corpse stays active while it is imbued with the wizard’s life. The wizard can instantly render it inert and dead by tapping its forehead thrice and speaking the channel termination protocol. They can then recover their life as usual. If the wizard is killed or otherwise removed from local spacetime while the undead is imbued, it becomes free of any control.

properties.name: Mindless servant
properties.description: Such an undead requires direct instructions from the wizard. They can then perform their instructions indefinitely (or until they erode away). Giving instructions during a conflict requires an action.

properties.name: Sacrificial life
properties.description: The wizard can replace the life force they have imbued in the corpse with another creature’s using a crushingly painful seventeen-minute ritual. The wizard can then recover their life force as usual. The sacrificial victim can only recover their life force if the corpse is ‘deactivated’ somehow.

wordsmayeverhurt.name: Words May Ever Hurt
wordsmayeverhurt.description: The logomanté uses their knowledge of the cosmic consciousness to spear their target’s essence.

ranks.effect: Cruel barb. Deals 1d6 damage and the target loses 1 defence for each action it takes on its next turn.
Bitter pill. 2d8 damage and the target suffers [-] for each action it takes on its next turn.
Skewering insight. 3d10 damage and the target loses an action on its next turn.
Crippling revelation. 4d12 damage and target suffers [-] vs attacks next round.
Mind-breaking truth. 5d20 damage and the target loses two actions on its next turn.
Hell does exist. 6d30 damage and if the target is reduced to 0 life, a portal to a kind of hell opens in its mind.

properties.name: Hell’s survivor
properties.description: A target sent into a hell of its own subconscious by this spell faces a very hard contest against itself and its own impulses. If it wins, it permanently gains 1 aura and thought when it returns to waking life.

properties.name: Ka/ba attack
properties.description: The wizard chooses the target defence.

properties.name: Singular
properties.description: Each power only works once per individual target.

properties.name: Sub-lethal
properties.description: A target reduced to 0 life by this spell does not die. It is left catatonic and vulnerable.
